orig: translate old to modern: Let no fair be kept in mind But the fair of Rosalind.
target: Don’t think of any beauty But the beauty of Rosalind.

orig: translate old to modern: Therefore, as I am bound, Receive it from me.
target: Therefore, as I am supposed to, Receive it from me.

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot live out of her company.
target: I cannot live without her.

orig: translate old to modern: I say, my daughter is my flesh and blood.
target: I say my daughter is my flesh and my blood.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou art armed, Gloucester.
target: You’ve got a sword, Gloucester.

orig: translate old to modern: Would she had never given you leave to come!
target: I wish she’d never let you come.

orig: translate old to modern: To a nunnery, go.
target: To a convent, go.

orig: translate old to modern: In mine eye she is the sweetest lady that ever I looked on.
target: I think she’s the most wonderful woman I’ve ever laid eyes on.

orig: translate old to modern: When the moon shone, we did not see the candle.
target: When the moon was shining, we did not see the candle.

orig: translate old to modern: Herein I see thou lov’st me not with the full weight that I love thee.
target: Well, by this I can see that you don’t love me as much as I love you.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, sir, in brief, the gown is not for me.
target: Well, sir, the gown is not for me.

orig: translate old to modern: There needs no ghost, my lord, come from the grave To tell us this.
target: We don’t need a ghost, my lord, to come from the grave To tell us this.

orig: translate old to modern: I have it, Tranio!
target: Tranio, I think I’ve got it!

orig: translate old to modern: What you have charged me with, that have I done— And more, much more.
target: I’ve done everything you accuse me of—and more, much more.

orig: translate old to modern: I have marked A thousand blushing apparitions To start into her face, a thousand innocent shames In angel whiteness beat away those blushes, And in her eye there hath appeared a fire To burn the errors that these princes hold Against her maiden truth.
target: And in her eyes I see a fire that would seem to burn away the lies the princes have told about her chastity.

orig: translate old to modern: This is the man.
target: This is the man.

orig: translate old to modern: speak, speak!
target: speak, speak!

orig: translate old to modern: They did so, to the amazement of mine eyes That look'd upon't.
target: They did, to the amazement of my eyes, That saw it.

orig: translate old to modern: There attend my coming.
target: Wait for me there.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy name is Gloucester.
target: Your name’s Gloucester.

orig: translate old to modern: These babes for Clarence weep and so do I; I for an Edward weep; so do not they.
target: These young children cry for Clarence and so do I, though they don’t cry for Edward, as I do.

orig: translate old to modern: Fare you well, sir.
target: Goodbye, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Seek, seek for him, Lest his ungoverned rage dissolve the life That wants the means to lead it.
target: Go find those herbs for him, before his madness puts his life in danger.

orig: translate old to modern: The basest horn of his hoof is more musical than the pipe of Hermes.
target: The lowest part of his hoof is more musical than Pan’s pipe.

orig: translate old to modern: And I.
target: And I.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, what i' devil’s name, tailor, call’st thou this?
target: What in the world do you call this, tailor!

orig: translate old to modern: In nothing am I changed But in my garments.
target: The only thing different about me is my clothes.

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, I shall study deserving.
target: I’ll try to make myself worth your knowledge.

orig: translate old to modern: As you shall prove us, praise us.
target: As you shall prove us to be, praise us.

orig: translate old to modern: Go prick thy face and over-red thy fear, Thou lily-liver'd boy.
target: Go prick your face and hide your fear in a red face, You lily-livered boy.

orig: translate old to modern: God give us leisure for these rites of love!
target: I hope we have the time some day!

orig: translate old to modern: To me you speak not.
target: Only you don’t speak to me.

orig: translate old to modern: Methinks he hath no drowning mark upon him; his complexion is perfect gallows.
target: I don’t think he has been marked for drowning: his complexion is perfect for being hanged.

orig: translate old to modern: Speak.
target: Tell us.

orig: translate old to modern: For the love of God, your help!
target: For the love of God, help us!

orig: translate old to modern: There, take my coxcomb.
target: There, take my fool’s cap.

orig: translate old to modern: I shall be reconciled to him again.
target: He and I will make up.

orig: translate old to modern: We will, we will!
target: We will, we will.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, that would dishonour him.
target: My lord, that would dishonor him.

orig: translate old to modern: Call my guard, I prithee.
target: Call my guard, please.

orig: translate old to modern: We have kissed away Kingdoms and provinces.
target: We have kissed away entire kingdoms and provinces.

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, I come to whet your gentle thoughts On his behalf.
target: Madam, I’ve come here to try to make you like him.

orig: translate old to modern: A proper saying!
target: A likely story!

orig: translate old to modern: See where she comes and brings your froward wives As prisoners to her womanly persuasion.— Katherine, that cap of yours becomes you not.
target: Look, here she comes, with your ungovernable wives in tow, like prisoners of her womanly persuasion.—Katherine, that cap of yours doesn’t look good on you.

orig: translate old to modern: This morning, like the spirit of a youth That means to be of note, begins betimes.
target: Like a young man who wants to amount to something, this morning begins early.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis better as it is.
target: It is better as it is.

orig: translate old to modern: Let me endure your wrath, if't be not so.
target: Let me suffer your anger if it isn’t so.

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, in this audience, Let my disclaiming from a purposed evil Free me so far in your most generous thoughts That I have shot my arrow o'er the house And hurt my brother.
target: Sir, before this audience, Let my denial of evil intent Give me immunity in your most generous thoughts As though I have shot my arrow over the house And hurt my brother.

orig: translate old to modern: Come for the third, Laertes!
target: Come, for the third, Laertes.

orig: translate old to modern: Then, at my farm I have a hundred milch-kine to the pail, Six score fat oxen standing in my stalls, And all things answerable to this portion.
target: Then, at my farm I have a hundred milk cows, a hundred and twenty fat oxen in my stables, and all the equipment necessary to maintain them.

orig: translate old to modern: Good morrow, my good lords.
target: Good morning, my good lords.

orig: translate old to modern: Soft, by and by.
target: Softly, by and by.

orig: translate old to modern: Indeed, it is a strange-disposed time; But men may construe things after their fashion, Clean from the purpose of the things themselves.
target: Indeed, time has a strange disposition But men may interpret things in whatever way they like, Far from the purpose of the things themselves.

orig: translate old to modern: This ensign here of mine was turning back; I slew the coward, and did take it from him.
target: This ensign of mine here was turning back; I killed the coward and took it from him.

orig: translate old to modern: To her that is not here, nor doth not hear.
target: I’m saying it to the girl who isn’t here and doesn’t hear me.

orig: translate old to modern: So foul and fair a day I have not seen.
target: I have never seen a day that is so disgustingly filthy and beautiful.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor you, as we are, loyal.
target: And you’re not loyal, like us.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, father, I’ll bestow you with a friend.
target: Come, father, I’ll leave you at a friend’s house.

orig: translate old to modern: We shall, my liege.
target: We shall, my liege.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy royal father Was a most sainted king: the queen that bore thee, Oftener upon her knees than on her feet, Died every day she lived.
target: Your royal father Was a most sainted king, the queen that bore you, Oftener upon her knees than on her feet, Died every day she lived.

orig: translate old to modern: Indeed, he hath an excellent good name.
target: True, he has an excellent reputation.

orig: translate old to modern: But how long fairly shall her sweet life last?
target: But how long will her beautiful life last?

orig: translate old to modern: Nobody marks you.
target: No one’s listening to you.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, every day, tomorrow.
target: Tomorrow, and then every day after that.

orig: translate old to modern: A bird of my tongue is better than a beast of yours.
target: I’d rather be a squawking bird than an animal like you.

orig: translate old to modern: Go you with me and I will use your skill.— Good cousin, have a care this busy time.
target: Come with me now, and help me out.

orig: translate old to modern: Or would you have me speak after my custom, as being a professed tyrant to their sex?
target: Or do you want me to criticize her like I do all women?

orig: translate old to modern: Prove that ever I lose more blood with love than I will get again with drinking, pick out mine eyes with a ballad-maker’s pen and hang me up at the door of a brothel house for the sign of blind Cupid.
target: If you can prove that I’ll ever be so in love that I can’t be brought to my senses with a good round of beers, you can pluck out my eyes with a love-poet’s pen and hang me on a brothel’s door where the picture of blind Cupid usually goes.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy smiles become thee well.
target: You’re so attractive when you smile.

orig: translate old to modern: Well be with you, gentlemen!
target: Welcome, gentlemen!

orig: translate old to modern: Now boast thee, Death, in thy possession lies A lass unparalleled.
target: Now, Death, you can boast that you have an incomparable girl in your possession.

orig: translate old to modern: Most necessary 'tis that we forget To pay ourselves what to ourselves is debt.
target: It is very necessary that we forget To pay ourselves what we owe to ourselves.

orig: translate old to modern: Would you desire lime and hair to speak better?
target: Do you need lime and hair to speak better?

orig: translate old to modern: Thus must I from the smoke into the smother, From tyrant duke unto a tyrant brother.
target: Out of the frying pan and into the fire—from a tyrant duke to a tyrant brother!

orig: translate old to modern: Shame of ladies, sisters!
target: Once she exclaimed, “Sisters, sisters, shame on you!

orig: translate old to modern: Call me what instrument you will, though you can fret me, you cannot play upon me.
target: Call me whatever instrument you want to, although you can try to cover my holes me, you can’t play me.

orig: translate old to modern: Who is't that cried?
target: Who is it that cried?

orig: translate old to modern: Let every eye nogetiate for itself And trust no agent, for beauty is a witch Against whose charms faith melteth into blood.
target: Beauty is a witch whose spells can turn loyalty into passion.

orig: translate old to modern: Hum!
target: Hum!

orig: translate old to modern: Were it not better, Because that I am more than common tall, That I did suit me all points like a man?
target: Wouldn’t it be better—since I’m unusually tall for a woman—to dress myself like a man?

orig: translate old to modern: Here, thou incestuous, murderous, damned Dane, Drink off this potion!
target: Here, you incestuous, murderous, damned Dane, Drink this potion.

orig: translate old to modern: Why did you bring these daggers from the place?
target: Why did you bring these daggers from the room?

orig: translate old to modern: No, sir.
target: No, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: This is some fellow, Who, having been praised for bluntness, doth affect A saucy roughness and constrains the garb Quite from his nature.
target: This is a guy who’s been praised for his honest bluntness, and who now insolently pretends to be plainspoken and twists the natural meanings of words.

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot think my sister in the least Would fail her obligation.
target: I can’t believe my sister would neglect her obligations in any way.

orig: translate old to modern: Look, he wears cruel garters.
target: That’s a nasty garter belt.

orig: translate old to modern: Know’st thou not That I have fined these bones of mine for ransom?
target: Don’t you know that I have offered these bones of mine for ransom?

orig: translate old to modern: Not yet old enough for a man, nor young enough for a boy, as a squash is before ’tis a peascod, or a codling when ’tis almost an apple.
target: Not old enough to be a man, but not young enough to be a boy.

orig: translate old to modern: The star is fall’n.
target: Our guiding light is out.

orig: translate old to modern: What a sigh is there!
target: What a sigh that is!

orig: translate old to modern: Let us toward the king.
target: Let’s go see the King.

orig: translate old to modern: What then?
target: What then?

orig: translate old to modern: There is no woman’s sides Can bide the beating of so strong a passion As love doth give my heart.
target: No woman is strong enough to put up with the kind of intense passion I feel.

orig: translate old to modern: Well then, the peace which you before so urged Lies in his answer.
target: Well, the peace you pleaded for so eloquently just now lies in his answer.

orig: translate old to modern: Fathers commonly Do get their children.
target: Usually fathers produce children, not the other way around.

orig: translate old to modern: Cry mercy, lords and watchful gentlemen, That you have ta'en a tardy sluggard here.
target: Pardon me, lords and gentlemen who stayed awake.

orig: translate old to modern: If he love Caesar, all that he can do Is to himself, take thought and die for Caesar.
target: If he loves Caesar, all that he can do Is what he can do to himself — think and die for Caesar.

orig: translate old to modern: And till she come, as truly as to heaven I do confess the vices of my blood, So justly to your grave ears I'll present How I did thrive in this fair lady's love And she in mine.
target: And, until she comes, as truly as I confess the vices of my blood to heaven, So I'll present truthfully, to your hearing, How I thrived in this beautiful lady's love, And she in mine.

orig: translate old to modern: Hast thou no mouth by land?
target: Don’t you Have any mouth on land?

orig: translate old to modern: Follow me not.
target: Don’t follow me.

orig: translate old to modern: I see him rouse himself To praise my noble act.
target: I see him revive himself to praise my noble act.

orig: translate old to modern: how am I beset!— What kind of catechizing call you this?
target: What kind of game is this?

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, a whole history.
target: Sir, I’ll give you a whole history.

orig: translate old to modern: Who comes here?
target: Who’s that?

orig: translate old to modern: Is it your dear friend that is thus in trouble?
target: Is it your dear friend that is in trouble like this?

orig: translate old to modern: Who ambles time withal?
target: Who does time amble for?

orig: translate old to modern: What men have you lost, Fluellen?
target: What men have you lost, Fluellen?

orig: translate old to modern: A most extracting frenzy of mine own From my remembrance clearly banished his.
target: I was so crazy myself that I forgot all about him.

orig: translate old to modern: Touch her soft mouth, and march.
target: Kiss her soft mouth, and we’ll be off.

orig: translate old to modern: But do not look for further recompense Than thine own gladness that thou art employed.
target: But don’t expect any more than that.

orig: translate old to modern: So shall you have a shorter journey to your desires by the means I shall then have to prefer them, and the impediment most profitably removed, with- out the which there were no expectation of our prosperity.
target: So you shall have a shorter journey to your desires by the means I would now have to advance them; and the impediment very profitably removed, without which we couldn’t expect to succeed.

orig: translate old to modern: Come to me again, And bring me word what he doth say to thee.
target: Come back to me again, And bring me word about what he says to you.

orig: translate old to modern: All three Now marry in an instant.
target: All three of us will marry now in death.

orig: translate old to modern: Your eldest daughters have fordone themselves, And desperately are dead.
target: Your eldest daughters destroyed themselves and died in despair.

orig: translate old to modern: It is a reeling world indeed, my lord, And I believe will never stand upright Till Richard wear the garland of the realm.
target: I believe it won’t stop moving and stand upright till Richard wears the wreath of the realm.

orig: translate old to modern: No, monster, not I.
target: No, monster, not me.

orig: translate old to modern: How will you live?
target: How will you live?

orig: translate old to modern: Should I lie, madam?
target: Do you want me to lie, madam?

orig: translate old to modern: Come Caesar to the Capitol tomorrow?
target: Does Caesar come to the Capitol tomorrow?

orig: translate old to modern: Go, bid the huntsmen wake them with their horns.
target: Go, bid the huntsmen wake them up by blowing the horns.

orig: translate old to modern: The foul practice Hath turn'd itself on me.
target: The evil deed Has turned itself on me.

orig: translate old to modern: Kings it makes gods, and meaner creatures kings.
target: It turns kings into gods and men of lower rank into kings.

orig: translate old to modern: For now, this fearful night, There is no stir or walking in the streets, And the complexion of the element In favor's like the work we have in hand, Most bloody, fiery, and most terrible.
target: For now, because of this fearful night, There’s no noise or walking in the streets, And the weather reflects The work we have at hand, Most bloody, fiery, and most terrible.

orig: translate old to modern: As willingly as e'er I came from school.
target: As eagerly as I ever came from school.

orig: translate old to modern: Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.
target: Go, go, you answer me with wickedness.

orig: translate old to modern: Let him go, And presently prefer his suit to Caesar.
target: Let him come, And now tell Caesar what it is that he wants.

orig: translate old to modern: A good soft pillow for that good white head Were better than a churlish turf of France.
target: A nice, soft pillow would be a more suitable place to lay that good white head than France’s hard, cold ground.

orig: translate old to modern: My resolution and my hands I’ll trust, None about Caesar.
target: I’ll trust my determination and my hands, but none of Caesar’s men.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, madam.
target: Yes, madam.

orig: translate old to modern: to Sebastian] He'd sow't with Or docks, or mallows.
target: Or the antidote for stinging plants or hollyhocks.

orig: translate old to modern: What traitor hears me and says not “Amen?” England hath long been mad and scarred herself.
target: What traitor hears me and doesn’t say amen?

orig: translate old to modern: The body is with the King, but the King is not with the body.
target: The body is with the king, but the king is not with the body.

orig: translate old to modern: Then lead the way, good father; and heavens so shine That they may fairly note this act of mine.
target: Then lead the way, father.

orig: translate old to modern: As wicked dew as e'er my mother brushed With raven's feather from unwholesome fen Drop on you both!
target: Let a dew as wicked as any my mother brushed From a polluted bog with raven's feather Fall on both of you!

orig: translate old to modern: Casca will tell us what the matter is.
target: Casca will tell us what’s wrong.

orig: translate old to modern: Come on, Trinculo, let us sing.
target: Come on, Trinculo, let us sing.

orig: translate old to modern: I have been in such a pickle since I saw you last that, I fear me, will never out of my bones.
target: I have been in similar a pickle since I saw you last that, I’m afraid, will never get out of my bones.

orig: translate old to modern: She cannot love Nor take no shape nor project of affection She is so self-endeared.
target: She can’t even imagine what “love” is.

orig: translate old to modern: Now, Iras, what think’st thou?
target: Now, Iras, what do you think?

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, you have bereft me of all words; Only my blood speaks to you in my veins, And there is such confusion in my powers, As, after some oration fairly spoke By a beloved prince, there doth appear Among the buzzing pleased multitude; Where every something, being blent together, Turns to a wild of nothing, save of joy, Express'd and not express'd.
target: Madam, you have made me speechless, Only my blood in my veins speaks to you, And I am so confused Just as there appears buzzing among a happy crowd After a well given speech By a beloved prince; Where every piece, blended together, Turns to something wild, expressed and not expressed, Except for joy.

orig: translate old to modern: O all you host of heaven!
target: O all you host of heaven!

orig: translate old to modern: Will they not say afterwards, if they should grow themselves to common players—as it is most like, if their means are no better—their writers do them wrong to make them exclaim against their own succession?
target: Won’t they say later, if they should go on to become common players, which is likely, and their lives are no better, that their writers did them wrong to make them exclaim against their own success?

orig: translate old to modern: But for the seventh cause.
target: But back to that argument you mentioned.

orig: translate old to modern: Strike not by land; keep whole.
target: Don’t attack by land.

orig: translate old to modern: The sister to my wife, this gentlewoman, Thy son by this hath married.
target: The sister of my wife, this lady here, is married to your son.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me any gage of thine, and I will wear it in my bonnet.
target: Give me some trinket of yours, and I will wear it in my hat.

orig: translate old to modern: unlawfully?
target: Unlawfully?

orig: translate old to modern: Come hither, Leonato.
target: Come here, Leonato.

orig: translate old to modern: Not in my husband’s nose.
target: Not in my husband’s nose.

orig: translate old to modern: Do so, and let no man abide this deed But we the doers.
target: Do so;— and let no man pay for this deed But we who did it.

orig: translate old to modern: Of thy misprision must perforce ensue Some true love turn'd, and not a false turn'd true.
target: Some true love turned false must follow because of your mistake, And not a false love turned true.

orig: translate old to modern: I know his trumpet.
target: I know his trumpet.

orig: translate old to modern: Hark.
target: Listen.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, what an ass am I!
target: Why, what an ass I am!

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, he has given example for our flight Most grossly by his own!
target: Oh, with his sordid desertion, he sets the example for our own.

orig: translate old to modern: Who does beguile you?
target: Who tricked you?

orig: translate old to modern: Is the storm overblown?
target: Hass the storm blown over?

orig: translate old to modern: Firm and irrevocable is my doom Which I have passed upon her.
target: The sentence I’ve passed down on her is firm and unshakeable.

orig: translate old to modern: O my dear Orlando, how it grieves me to see thee wear thy heart in a scarf.
target: Oh, darling Orlando, it’s so hard to see you wearing your heart in a sling.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou wast provokèd by thy bloody mind, That never dream’st on aught but butcheries.
target: No, what provoked you was your own bloody mind, which never thinks about anything but butchering.

orig: translate old to modern: I will help you to ’t.
target: I’ll help you.

orig: translate old to modern: But this good comfort bring I to your Highness: The Breton navy is dispersed by tempest.
target: Yes, your Highness.

orig: translate old to modern: Know, my hearts, I hope well of tomorrow, and will lead you Where rather I’ll expect victorious life Than death and honor.
target: You should know, my friends, that I have good hopes for tomorrow, and that I will lead you as if I expect victory rather than an honorable death.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll wear none but this.
target: I’ll wear this one and none other.

orig: translate old to modern: No, you shall paint when you are old.
target: No, he means you’ll use makeup when you’re old.

orig: translate old to modern: We are enough yet living in the field To smother up the English in our throngs, If any order might be thought upon.
target: There are enough of us still alive in the field to overcome the English with our numbers if we could just restore some kind of order.

orig: translate old to modern: Then shall the sighs of Octavia blow the fire up in Caesar, and, as I said before, that which is the strength of their amity shall prove the immediate author of their variance.
target: Then Octavia’s complaints will rouse Caesar, and as I said before, the thing that brought them together will part them.

orig: translate old to modern: What, girl, though gray Do something mingle with our younger brown, yet ha’ we A brain that nourishes our nerves and can Get goal for goal of youth.
target: What do you think, girl!

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, in the temple, in the town, the field, You do me mischief.
target: Ay, in the temple, in the town, the field, You do something to me.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, sir, will you aboard?
target: Come on, sir, will you come aboard?

orig: translate old to modern: If thy revengeful heart cannot forgive, Lo, here I lend thee this sharp-pointed sword, Which if thou please to hide in this true breast And let the soul forth that adoreth thee, I lay it naked to the deadly stroke And humbly beg the death upon my knee.
target: If your vengeful heart can’t forgive me, here—take my sword and bury it in my heart so that my soul, which adores you, can be free.

orig: translate old to modern: Draw thy sword—one stroke Shall free thee from the tribute which thou payest, And I the King shall love thee.
target: Draw your sword: one stroke Shall free you from the taxes which you pay, And I the king shall be devoted to you.

orig: translate old to modern: Virtue itself 'scapes not calumnious strokes.
target: Virtue itself doesn’t aim at lying deeds.

orig: translate old to modern: I will not be long from you.
target: I won’t be gone long.

orig: translate old to modern: For Edward, for my brother, for his sake.
target: For my brother Edward’s sake.

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot speak of this.
target: I cannot speak about this.

orig: translate old to modern: We have been praying for our husbands' welfare, Which speed, we hope, the better for our words.
target: We have been praying for our husbands' welfare, Which are moving along quickly, we hope, the better For our words.

orig: translate old to modern: Truly, sir, the better for my foes and the worse for my friends.
target: I’m better off because of my enemies, and worse off because of my friends.

orig: translate old to modern: Do you hear?
target: Do you hear me?

orig: translate old to modern: Prithee, be not angry.
target: Please don’t be angry.

orig: translate old to modern: Let all the rest give place.
target: All the rest of you can leave too.

orig: translate old to modern: Wast ever in court, shepherd?
target: Were you ever at court, shepherd?

orig: translate old to modern: Come hither, sirrah.
target: Come here, servant.

orig: translate old to modern: The point envenom'd too!
target: The point poisoned too!

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll drink to her as long as there is a passage in my throat and drink in Illyria.
target: I’ll drink to her as long as there’s a hole in my throat and booze in Illyria.

orig: translate old to modern: I am dead, Horatio.
target: I am dead, Horatio.

orig: translate old to modern: Thanks, courteous wall.
target: Thanks, courteous wall.

orig: translate old to modern: It shall lose thee nothing.
target: You won’t lose any respect.

orig: translate old to modern: I heard it not.
target: I didn’t hear it.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, come again, Good Kate.
target: No, come back, Kate.

orig: translate old to modern: Then is Caesar and he forever knit together.
target: Then Caesar and he will always be united.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, ho!
target: Oh ho!

orig: translate old to modern: Fie on her!
target: The hell with her!

orig: translate old to modern: I love thee not, therefore pursue me not.
target: I don’t love you, so stop following me.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet, by your gracious patience, I will a round unvarnish'd tale deliver Of my whole course of love: what drugs, what charms, What conjuration, and what mighty magic For such proceeding I am charged withal I won his daughter.
target: Yet, by your gracious patience, I will deliver a round truthful tale Of my whole course of love, by what drugs, what charms, What invocation, and what mighty magic, Because I am charged with such crimes, I won his daughter.

orig: translate old to modern: Go fetch fire.
target: Go, go get fire.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell Antony, Brutus is ta'en.
target: Tell Antony, Brutus is taken.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, bring us, bring us where he is.
target: Come on, take us to him.

orig: translate old to modern: Whiles I threat, he lives; Words to the heat of deeds too cold breath gives.
target: While I threaten, he lives; Words give breath to the heat of deeds that are too cold.

orig: translate old to modern: But if the cause be not good, the king himself hath a heavy reckoning to make, when all those legs and arms and heads, chopped off in a battle, shall join together at the latter day, and cry all, “We died at such a place,” some swearing, some crying for a surgeon, some upon their wives left poor behind them, some upon the debts they owe, some upon their children rawly left.
target: But if the cause is not just, the king himself will have a lot to answer for, when all those legs and arms and heads chopped off in battle shall join together on Judgment Day crying, “We died at such and such a place.” Some will be swearing, some crying for a surgeon, some for the wives that are destitute without them, some about the debts they owed, some for their children left unprovided for.

orig: translate old to modern: Our queen and all her elves come here anon.
target: Our queen and all her elves are coming here any minute!

orig: translate old to modern: If I can catch him once upon the hip, I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.
target: If I can catch him once at a disadvantage, I’ll feed the ancient grudge I bear him until it’s fat.

orig: translate old to modern: Brother, good night.
target: Good night, brother.

orig: translate old to modern: So please you, he is here at the door and importunes access to you.
target: Yes, sir, he’s here at the door right now and asks to see you.

orig: translate old to modern: A more unhappy lady, If this division chance, ne’er stood between, Praying for both parts.
target: No lady could be more miserable than I if you two disagree.

orig: translate old to modern: O, the more angel she, And you the blacker devil!
target: O, she is more the angel, And you the blacker devil!

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound, That breathes upon a bank of violets, Stealing and giving odor.
target: Oh, it sounded like a sweet breeze blowing gently over a bank of violets, taking their scent with it.

orig: translate old to modern: No, unpin me here.
target: No, unpin my hair.

orig: translate old to modern: Fetch forth the stocks!
target: Bring out the stocks!

orig: translate old to modern: You are rather point-device in your accouterments, as loving yourself than seeming the lover of any other.
target: You’re so neat and well put-together that you look like you love yourself more than anyone else.

orig: translate old to modern: Good my lord, be quiet.
target: My good lord, be quiet.

orig: translate old to modern: Hear me, you wrangling pirates, that fall out In sharing that which you have pilled from me!
target: Hear me, you wrangling pirates.

orig: translate old to modern: What man was he talked with you yesternight Out at your window betwixt twelve and one?
target: What man were you talking to at your window last night, between the hours of midnight and one?

orig: translate old to modern: Think of it.
target: Think about it.

orig: translate old to modern: Wilt thou have me?
target: Will you have me?

orig: translate old to modern: Besides, you grow dishonest.
target: Besides, you’ve gotten unreliable.

orig: translate old to modern: He is the only man of Italy, Always excepted my dear Claudio.
target: He’s the only worthy man in Italy, aside from my dear Claudio.

orig: translate old to modern: O, teach me how you look, and with what art You sway the motion of Demetrius' heart!
target: Oh, teach me your look, and with what magic You have stolen Demetrius' heart!

orig: translate old to modern: Marry, sir, they have committed false report; moreover, they have spoken untruths; secondarily, they are slanders; sixth and lastly, they have belied a lady; thirdly, they have verified unjust things; and, to conclude, they are lying knaves.
target: Well sir, they’ve lied; moreover, they have said things that were not true; secondarily, they are slanderers; sixth and lastly, they have falsely accused a lady; thirdly, they have confirmed things that did not in fact happen; and, in conclusion, they are lying scoundrels.

orig: translate old to modern: Then shall we find tomorrow they have only stomachs to eat and none to fight.
target: Then tomorrow we’ll find that they feel only like eating, not like fighting.

orig: translate old to modern: Why?
target: Why?

orig: translate old to modern: Pray heaven it be state matters, as you think, And no conception nor no jealous toy Concerning you.
target: Pray heaven it is state matters, as you think, And no plot or no jealous reason Concerning you.

orig: translate old to modern: See, my women, Against the blown rose may they stop their nose, That kneeled unto the buds.—Admit him, sir.
target: See, ladies, how they scorn me now.

orig: translate old to modern: His eyes are humbler than they used to be.
target: He looks humbler than he used to.

orig: translate old to modern: They do offend our sight.
target: The sight of them is offensive.

orig: translate old to modern: Shalt see thy other daughter will use thee kindly.
target: Your other daughter Regan will treat you kindly, you’ll see.

orig: translate old to modern: Your Grace attended to their sugared words But looked not on the poison of their hearts.
target: Your Grace heard their saccharine words, but didn’t take note of their poisonous intentions.

orig: translate old to modern: In the way of argument, look you, and friendly communication, partly to satisfy my opinion, and partly for the satisfaction, look you, of my mind, as touching the direction of the military discipline, that is the point.
target: Partly to confirm my opinion and partly for the satisfaction, see, of my mind, with respect to the demands of proper military practice—that’s the point?

orig: translate old to modern: Now, mother, what's the matter?
target: Now, mother, what's the matter?

orig: translate old to modern: Welcome, destruction, blood, and massacre.
target: Welcome, destruction, blood, and massacre!

orig: translate old to modern: I heard myself proclaimed, And by the happy hollow of a tree Escaped the hunt.
target: I heard myself declared an outlaw and escaped capture by hiding in the trunk of a hollow tree.

orig: translate old to modern: In him there is a hope of government, Which, in his nonage, council under him, And, in his full and ripened years, himself, No doubt shall then, and till then, govern well.
target: His counselors will govern as long as he’s a minor, and then he’ll take over.

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you, bring me on the way a little; And say if I shall see you soon at night.
target: I beg you, walk with me on the way a little; And say if I shall see you later tonight.

orig: translate old to modern: Pray you, let’s sit together.
target: Let’s put our heads together.

orig: translate old to modern: Well held out, i' faith.
target: Good for you, holding out on me like this!

orig: translate old to modern: She dying gave it me, And bid me, when my fate would have me wive, To give it her.
target: My mother, dying, gave it to me, And asked me, when my fate would have me marry, To give it to my wife.

orig: translate old to modern: I will tomorrow, And betimes I will, to the weird sisters.
target: I will go tomorrow, (And I will go early in the morning) to the weird sisters.

orig: translate old to modern: Hence!
target: Away!

orig: translate old to modern: Stood the state so?
target: Really?

orig: translate old to modern: Let us bear him  To th’ court of guard.
target: Let’s carry him to the barracks.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis true my brother's daughter's Queen of Tunis; So is she heir of Naples; ’twixt which regions There is some space.
target: It’s true, my brother's daughter is Queen of Tunis; She also inherits Naples; there is some distance Between the two countries.

orig: translate old to modern: God bless you, sir.
target: God bless you, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Madness in great ones must not unwatch'd go.
target: Craziness in great ones must not go unwatched.

orig: translate old to modern: No eyes in your head, nor no money in your purse?
target: No eyes in your head til there’s money in your wallet?

orig: translate old to modern: If you meet the Prince in the night, you may stay him.
target: If you meet the Prince in the night, you can order him to stop.

orig: translate old to modern: Your statue spouting blood in many pipes, 90 In which so many smiling Romans bathed, Signifies that from you great Rome shall suck Reviving blood, and that great men shall press For tinctures, stains, relics, and cognizance.
target: Your statue spouting blood in many pipes, In which so many smiling Romans bathed, Signifies that, from you, great Rome shall suck Reviving blood, and that great men shall ask For tinctures, stains, relics, and recognition.

orig: translate old to modern: Will it not be received, When we have mark'd with blood those sleepy two Of his own chamber, and used their very daggers, That they have done't?
target: Won’t it be understood, When we have marked those sleepy two Of his own chamber with blood, and used their very own daggers, That they have done it?

orig: translate old to modern: Warm o'my troth!
target: Warm, honestly!

orig: translate old to modern: So doth the greater glory dim the less: A substitute shines brightly as a king, Unto the king be by; and then his state, Empties itself, as doth an inland brook Into the main of waters.
target: A substitute shines as brightly as a king Until a king is back, and then the substitute’s Condition drains away, as an inland brook does Into the river of waters.

orig: translate old to modern: Ready, my lord.
target: They’re ready, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: I did love you once.
target: I did love you once.

orig: translate old to modern: When our actions do not, Our fears do make us traitors.
target: When our actions do not make us traitors, Our fears do.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, then, take no note of him, but let him go and presently call the rest of the watch together and thank God you are rid of a knave.
target: Then immediately call the rest of the watch together and thank God that you’ve gotten rid of such a criminal.

orig: translate old to modern: You’re welcome, sir, and he for your good sake.
target: You and he are both welcome, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: And not one vessel 'scape the dreadful touch Of merchant-marring rocks?
target: And not one vessel escaped the dreadful touch Of the rocks that can break a merchant?

orig: translate old to modern: Moon-calf, speak once in thy life, if thou beest a good moon-calf.
target: Dreamer, speak once in your life, if you are a good dreamer.

orig: translate old to modern: Look you, sir, such a one I was this present.
target: Look, sir, this is a portrait of me as I am at this particular moment.

orig: translate old to modern: It is proved my Lady Hero hath been falsely accused, the Prince and Claudio mightily abused, and Don John is the author of all, who is fled and gone.
target: It’s been proven that Lady Hero is innocent, that the Prince and Claudio have been utterly deceived, and that Don John—who has run away—is the source of all the trouble.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me my robe, for I will go.
target: Give me my robe, because I’ll go.

orig: translate old to modern: Here’s that shall drive some of them to a noncome.
target: We’ll drive them to a

orig: translate old to modern: sings] [sings] Come unto these yellow sands, And than take hands; Curtsied when you have and the kissed— The wild waves whist— Foot it featly here and there, And, sweet sprites, bear The burden.
target: Come to these yellow sands, And then take my hands: Bow courteously when you have and kiss me,— The wild waves are silent,— Dance gracefully here and there; And, sweet spirits, listen to the chorus.

orig: translate old to modern: What do you think of me?
target: What do you think of me?

orig: translate old to modern: Come hither, you rogue!
target: Come here, you wretch!

orig: translate old to modern: If that may be, then all is well.
target: If that can be done, then I think we’ve covered everything.

orig: translate old to modern: Now, then, we’ll use His countenance for the battle, which being done, Let her who would be rid of him devise His speedy taking off.
target: I’ll use Albany’s power and authority for now to win the war, but afterward one of the sisters—whichever one wants to—can get rid of him.

orig: translate old to modern: I know thee well—a serviceable villain, As duteous to the vices of thy mistress As badness would desire.
target: You’re a hardworking villain who’d do anything his evil mistress wanted him to.

orig: translate old to modern: Lips, do not move; No man must know.”
target: I can’t let my lips say his name; “No man must know.”

orig: translate old to modern: Hear it not, Duncan, for it is a knell That summons thee to heaven, or to hell.
target: Don’t hear it, Duncan, for it is a sorrowful omen of death That summons you to heaven or to hell.

orig: translate old to modern: What have you done?
target: What have you two sisters done?

orig: translate old to modern: What, Brutus?
target: What, Brutus?

orig: translate old to modern: I had forgot thee.
target: I had forgotten about you.

orig: translate old to modern: He’s bound unto Octavia.
target: He’s bound to Octavia.

orig: translate old to modern: He that conceals him, death.
target: justice will be rewarded.

orig: translate old to modern: Now lies he there, And none so poor to do him reverence.
target: Now lies he there, And there is no one too poor to pay him respect.

orig: translate old to modern: How say you, Signior Gremio?
target: What do you say, Signior Gremio?

orig: translate old to modern: Let’s stab ourselves.
target: Let’s fall on our swords.

orig: translate old to modern: Of fighting men they have full threescore thousand.
target: They have fully sixty thousand fighting men.

orig: translate old to modern: You’ve strange serpents there?
target: Do you have unusual snakes there?

orig: translate old to modern: em all three all ready.
target: It’s only for your willing and receptive ear.

orig: translate old to modern: It is so.
target: Fair enough.

orig: translate old to modern: No, I will weep no more.
target: No, I won’t cry any more.

orig: translate old to modern: Bring him before us.
target: Bring him before us.

orig: translate old to modern: How canst thou woo her?
target: How would you woo her?

orig: translate old to modern: Think’st thou that duty shall have dread to speak When power to flattery bows?
target: When powerful kings cave in to flatterers, do you think loyal men will be afraid to speak out against it?

orig: translate old to modern: He loves me well, and I have given him reasons; Send him but hither, and I'll fashion him.
target: He likes me very well, and I have given him cause to; Just send him here, and I'll train him.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, you are sick of self-love, Malvolio, and taste with a distempered appetite.
target: Malvolio, your vanity is damaging your good taste.

orig: translate old to modern: Well moused, Lion.
target: Well moused, lion.

orig: translate old to modern: Let some of my people have a special care of him.
target: Have some of my servants take care of Malvolio.

orig: translate old to modern: Stay, gentle Helena; hear my excuse; My love, my life, my soul, fair Helena!
target: Stay, gentle Helena; hear my reason; My love, my life, my soul, fair Helena!

orig: translate old to modern: Will you have some more sauce to your leek?
target: Would you like some more sauce to go with it?

orig: translate old to modern: What committed.
target: What committed!

orig: translate old to modern: O, If you but knew how you the purpose cherish Whiles thus you mock it; how in stripping it.
target: If you only knew how you appreciate the purpose While you mock it like this!

orig: translate old to modern: Pluck down benches.
target: Grab down benches.

orig: translate old to modern: Who stays it still withal?
target: Who does it stand still for?

orig: translate old to modern: O that my prayers could such affection move!
target: Oh that my prayers could be answered with such affection!

orig: translate old to modern: Hymen from heaven brought her, Yea, brought her hither, That thou mightst join her hand with his Whose heart within his bosom is.
target: Hymen brought her from heaven Yes, brought her here.

orig: translate old to modern: I hope he be in love.
target: I hope he’s in love.

orig: translate old to modern: For the table, sir, it shall be served in; for the meat, sir, it shall be covered; for your coming into dinner, sir, why, let it be as humours and conceits shall govern.
target: For the table, sir, it shall be served in; for the meat, sir, it shall be covered; for your coming in to dinner, sir, why, let it be as sense and meaning shall determine.

orig: translate old to modern: Let our reciprocal vows be remembered.
target: Don’t forget the vows we made to each other.

orig: translate old to modern: Most happy!
target: What good luck!

orig: translate old to modern: We will have no telling.
target: There will be no lecture.

orig: translate old to modern: I will weep for thee, For this revolt of thine methinks is like Another fall of man.—Their faults are open.
target: This treachery of yours is like the second

orig: translate old to modern: O the heavens!
target: Oh, the heavens!

orig: translate old to modern: O, 'tis foul in her.
target: O, it is evil in her.

orig: translate old to modern: But I am shepherd to another man And do not shear the fleeces that I graze.
target: But I’m a hired hand: I don’t profit from the flocks I tend.

orig: translate old to modern: Go thou.
target: Go ahead.

orig: translate old to modern: Young Fortinbras, with conquest come from Poland, To the ambassadors of England gives This warlike volley.
target: Young Fortinbras, after conquering Poland, Gives this warlike volley To the ambassadors of England.

orig: translate old to modern: Dear my lord, Be not familiar with her.
target: Please, my lord, don’t be friendly with her.

orig: translate old to modern: Briefly, I dwell by the Capitol.
target: Briefly, I live by the Capitol.

orig: translate old to modern: Not a jot, not a jot.
target: Not a jot, not a jot.

orig: translate old to modern: I will praise any man that will praise me, though it cannot be denied what I have done by land.
target: I’ll flatter anyone who flatters me—though what I’ve accomplished on land cannot be denied.

orig: translate old to modern: And then, sir, does he this—he does—what was I about to say?
target: And then, sir, ask if he does this, does he--What was I about to say?

orig: translate old to modern: We must bear all.
target: What a painful condition responsibility is.

orig: translate old to modern: Upon the right hand I, keep thou the left.
target: I will be on the right hand; you keep to the left.

orig: translate old to modern: Strike the vessels, ho!
target: Clink your cups together in a toast!

orig: translate old to modern: Had you such leisure in the time of death To gaze upon the secrets of the deep?
target: So you had time as you were dying to look around?

orig: translate old to modern: For your dwelling, briefly.
target: For your house,—briefly.

orig: translate old to modern: For, by my fay, I cannot reason.
target: for, by my faith, I cannot reason.

orig: translate old to modern: And ere I take this charm from off her sight, As I can take it with another herb, I'll make her render up her page to me.
target: And before I remove this charm from her sight — Because I have another herb that is the antidote — I'll make her give that boy to me.

orig: translate old to modern: I had a pass with him, rapier, scabbard, and all, and he gives me the stuck-in with such a mortal motion, that it is inevitable.
target: I had a round with him, and his sword thrust is so deadly that you can’t even duck out of the way.

orig: translate old to modern: For better might we Have loved without this mean, if on both parts This be not cherished.
target: If you and I don’t value her equally, it would be better for us to work out our differences without her.

orig: translate old to modern: I have rubb'd this young quat almost to the sense, And he grows angry.
target: I have rubbed this young pimple almost to the purpose, And he grows angry.

orig: translate old to modern: The Count Claudio shall marry the daughter of Leonato.
target: The Count Claudio will marry Leonato’s daughter.

orig: translate old to modern: O villain!
target: O villain!

orig: translate old to modern: God speed fair Helena!
target: Hi, fair Helena!

orig: translate old to modern: Brutus, this sober form of yours hides wrongs, And when you do them— Cassius, be content, Speak your griefs softly, I do know you well.
target: Brutus, this sober face of yours hides wrongs; And when you do them— Cassius, please.

orig: translate old to modern: Dost thou not suspect my place?
target: Don’t you suspect my office?

orig: translate old to modern: The same.
target: That’s me.

orig: translate old to modern: See for the news.
target: Look for the news.

orig: translate old to modern: Truly, Sir, all that I live by is with the awl; I meddle with no tradesman's matters, nor women's matters, but with awl.
target: Truly, Sir, all that I live by is with the sharp little tool; I don’t stick my nose into any tradesman's matters, or women's matters, but with awl.

orig: translate old to modern: True, sir.
target: That’s true, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Do not doubt, Cassio, But I will have my lord and you again As friendly as you were.
target: Don’t doubt it, Cassio, That I will have my lord and you As friendly again as you were.

orig: translate old to modern: whither wander you?
target: Where are you going?

orig: translate old to modern: O, you are novices!
target: You men are rank beginners!

orig: translate old to modern: Ho, ho, ho!
target: Ho, ho, ho, ho!

orig: translate old to modern: How I have thought of this and of these times, I shall recount hereafter; for this present, I would not, so with love I might entreat you, Be any further moved.
target: I’ll tell you later what I’ve thought about this And about these times,; for now, Please don’t to try to persuade me any further.

orig: translate old to modern: On my knees I beg That you’ll vouchsafe me raiment, bed, and food.” Good sir, no more.
target: No more, please.

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you, father, being weak, seem so.
target: Please, father, since you’re weak, act like it.

orig: translate old to modern: Why should that name be sounded more than yours?
target: Why should that name be sounded any more than yours?

orig: translate old to modern: But till that time I do receive your offer'd love like love, And will not wrong it.
target: But until that time, I receive your offered love like love, And won’t do it wrong.

orig: translate old to modern: Zounds, I’ll entreat no more.
target: But listen, if

orig: translate old to modern: Who are they?
target: Who said that?

orig: translate old to modern: This is more strange Than such a murder is.
target: This ghost is more strange Than such a murder is.

orig: translate old to modern: So let him land, And solemnly see him set on to London.
target: Let’s have him land and solemnly proceed to London.

orig: translate old to modern: Who you are and what you would are out of my welkin, I might say “element,” but the word is overworn.
target: I’d say I was “out of my element,” but that phrase is overused, so I’ll say I’m “out of my air.”

orig: translate old to modern: This jack of Caesar’s shall Bear us an errand to him.
target: Caesar’s knave will bring him a message for us.

orig: translate old to modern: Indeed!
target: Indeed!

orig: translate old to modern: What says Polonius?
target: What says Polonius?

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, you have done me wrong, Notorious wrong.
target: Madam, you’ve treated me badly, very badly.

orig: translate old to modern: What’s she?
target: Who’s she?

orig: translate old to modern: Ding, dong, bell.
target: Ding, dong, bell.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, I will have thee, but, by this light, I take thee for pity.
target: Come on, I’ll take you, but honestly I’m only doing it out of pity.

orig: translate old to modern: Roderigo kill'd?
target: Roderigo killed?

orig: translate old to modern: Gods and goddesses, All the whole synod of them!
target: The Egyptian flagship, the  Gods and goddesses—the whole congregation of them!

orig: translate old to modern: But if he had not been in drink, he would have tickled you othergates than he did.
target: If he hadn’t been drunk, he would’ve really roughed you up.

orig: translate old to modern: My charms I'll break, their senses I'll restore, And they shall be themselves.
target: I'll break my spells, I'll restore their senses, And they shall be themselves again.

orig: translate old to modern: No, nor more fearful.
target: No, nor more fearful.

orig: translate old to modern: For my part, I am sorry it is turned to a drinking.
target: For my part, I’m sorry this battle turned into a drinking match.

orig: translate old to modern: But two months dead!
target: Only dead for two months!

orig: translate old to modern: Sir?
target: Sir?

orig: translate old to modern: Wrong not her birth.
target: Don’t wrong her birth.

orig: translate old to modern: How does my bounteous sister?
target: How does my generous sister?

orig: translate old to modern: And so adieu, good madam.
target: So goodbye, my lady.

orig: translate old to modern: My mind hath been as big as one of yours, My heart as great, my reason haply more, To bandy word for word and frown for frown.
target: My spirit has been as proud as each of yours, my courage as great, and my reason perhaps even better suited to bandy words back and forth and exchange frown for frown.

orig: translate old to modern: Look what is done cannot be now amended.
target: Whatever has already been done can’t be undone now.

orig: translate old to modern: I could well wish courtesy would invent some other custom of entertainment.
target: I could really wish manners would invent some other kind of entertainment.

orig: translate old to modern: Is it not strange, Canidius, That from Tarentum and Brundusium He could so quickly cut the Ionian sea And take in Toryne?—You have heard on ’t, sweet?
target: Isn’t it strange, Canidius, that he could cross the Ionian Sea so quickly from Tarentum and Brundusium and take Toryne?—Have you heard about this, sweet?

orig: translate old to modern: What manner of man?
target: I mean, what sort of man is he?

orig: translate old to modern: Machinations, hollowness, treachery, and all ruinous disorders follow us disquietly to our graves.
target: Conspiracies, fakery, betrayal, and disorder are all that’s left until we die.

orig: translate old to modern: Was not Charles, the duke’s wrestler, here to speak with me?
target: Wasn’t Charles, the duke’s wrestler, here to speak with me?

orig: translate old to modern: And, sister, as the winds give benefit And convoy is assistant, do not sleep, But let me hear from you.
target: And, sister, as the winds will be favorable And the ships are strong to sail, don’t sleep, Until you let me hear from you.

orig: translate old to modern: To relate the manner Were, on the quarry of these murder'd deer, To add the death of you.
target: To relate the details Would be, on the numbers of these murdered deer, To add to your own death.

orig: translate old to modern: It is a letter from my brother that I have not all o'er-read.
target: It’s a letter from my brother that I haven’t finished reading yet.

orig: translate old to modern: O, one too much by thee!
target: Oh, one child is one too many!

orig: translate old to modern: O Ratcliffe, I have dreamed a fearful dream!
target: Oh Ratcliffe, I had a terrifying dream!

orig: translate old to modern: Quiet thy cudgel.
target: Lay off, already!

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, can you tell Where he bestows himself?
target: Sir, can you tell Where he is?

orig: translate old to modern: I'll have some proof.
target: I'll have some proof.

orig: translate old to modern: Most certain, sir.
target: Yes, it’s true, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: He hath lost his fellows, And strays about to find ’em I might call him A thing divine, for nothing natural I ever saw so noble.
target: I might call him A divine thing; because I have never seen Anything so natural that was so noble.

orig: translate old to modern: Fool!
target: Fool!

orig: translate old to modern: O noble Emperor, do not fight by sea!

orig: translate old to modern: This is open.

target: Yes, and said nothing except that which I have every intention of doing.

target: An Englishman?

target: I’ll wait till his beard grows in, if you’ll just hurry up and tell me what chin that beard is on.

orig: translate old to modern: a fair woman!

target: and long live you to think so!
