orig: translate old to modern: Hie thee, gentle Jew.
target: Hurry, gentle Jew.

orig: translate old to modern: By my faith, you have great reason to be sad.
target: Well then, you have good reason to be sad.

orig: translate old to modern: Out, dog!
target: Get out, dog!

orig: translate old to modern: The very best at a beast, my lord, that e'er I saw.
target: The very best at a beast, my lord, that ever I saw.

orig: translate old to modern: No.
target: No.

orig: translate old to modern: That were a kind of bastard hope, indeed; so, the sins of my mother should be visited upon me.
target: That’s a kind of bastard hope indeed; so the sins of my mother should be laid on me.

orig: translate old to modern: Call you me daughter?
target: You have the nerve to call me daughter?

orig: translate old to modern: Tis one Iago, ancient to the general.
target: It is one Iago, ensign to the general.

orig: translate old to modern: What foul play had we that we came from thence?
target: What foul play did we have that we left there?

orig: translate old to modern: I will say so.
target: I will say so.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, he spoke Greek.
target: Yes, he spoke in Greek.

orig: translate old to modern: Wilt thou, Strato?
target: Will you, Strato?

orig: translate old to modern: No, hath not?
target: Oh, he hasn’t?

orig: translate old to modern: Gloucester’s eyes?
target: Gloucester’s eyes?

orig: translate old to modern: I am your spaniel; and, Demetrius, The more you beat me, I will fawn on you.
target: I am your spaniel, and, Demetrius, The more you beat me, the more I will wag my tail for you.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, thou shalt see, thy eyes shall be thy judge, The difference of old Shylock and Bassanio:— What, Jessica!—thou shalt not gormandise, As thou hast done with me;—What, Jessica!— And sleep, and snore, and rend apparel out;— Why, Jessica, I say!
target: Well, you shall see; your eyes shall be your judge, The difference of old Shylock and Bassanio:— What, Jessica!—You won’t eat like a glutton, As you have done with me;—What, Jessica!— And sleep and snore, and tear clothes apart— Why, Jessica, I say!

orig: translate old to modern: Othello!
target: Othello!

orig: translate old to modern: No, Corin, being old, thou canst not guess, Though in thy youth thou wast as true a lover As ever sighed upon a midnight pillow.
target: No Corin, since you’re old, you cannot guess—even if you were as dedicated a lover in your youth as there ever was, sighing and mooning all night long.

orig: translate old to modern: What news from her?
target: What have you heard from her?

orig: translate old to modern: If I live to see it, I will never trust his word after.
target: If I live to see it, I’ll never trust his word again.

orig: translate old to modern: What’s that, I pray?
target: And that would be—?

orig: translate old to modern: No, my heart is turned to stone; I strike it, and it hurts my hand.
target: No, my heart is turned to stone; I hit it, and it hurts my hand.

orig: translate old to modern: The King's son have I landed by himself, Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs In an odd angle of the isle, and sitting, His arms in this sad knot.
target: I have brought the king's son ashore by himself, And I left him cooling off with the air that blows gently In a remote spot of the island, and sitting, His arms sadly folded like this.

orig: translate old to modern: Why doth the Jew pause?
target: Why does the Jew wait?

orig: translate old to modern: And so have I a noble father lost; A sister driven into desperate terms, Whose worth, if praises may go back again, Stood challenger on mount of all the age For her perfections.
target: And so I have lost a noble father, A sister driven into insanity, Whose worth, if praises may go back again, Stood as a challenger to the most beautiful woman of all Time for her perfections.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, then I shall see thee again?
target: Well; then I shall see you again?

orig: translate old to modern: It was the owl that shriek'd, the fatal bellman, Which gives the stern'st good-night.
target: It was the owl that shrieked, the fatal bellman, That gives even the worst dispositions a good night.

orig: translate old to modern: You look pale and gaze And put on fear and cast yourself in wonder, To see the strange impatience of the heavens.
target: You look pale and dazed, And put on fear and make yourself wonder, To see the strange behavior of the Heavens.

orig: translate old to modern: Where hast thou sent the king?
target: Where have you sent the king?

orig: translate old to modern: Now I begin: Imprimis, we came down a foul hill, my master riding behind my mistress— Both of one horse?
target: Now, I’ll begin: first, we came down a steep hill, my master riding behind my mistress— Both on one horse?

orig: translate old to modern: By my troth, thou hast an open hand.
target: Well, well.

orig: translate old to modern: Return with her?
target: Go back with her?

orig: translate old to modern: Or rather bottomless, that as fast as you pour affection in, it runs out.
target: Or it’s bottomless, at least: pour affection in one end, and it runs out the other.

orig: translate old to modern: Never—O fault!—revealed myself unto him Until some half-hour past, when I was armed.
target: I never—oh, what a mistake!—revealed myself to him until half an hour ago, when I was in my armor.

orig: translate old to modern: I may not leave it so.
target: I can’t do this.

orig: translate old to modern: He is dead and gone, lady, He is dead and gone; At his head a grass-green turf, At his heels a stone.
target: He is dead and gone, lady, He is dead and gone, At his head a grass green turf, At his heels a stone.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis hard; almost impossible.
target: It would be hard, almost impossible.

orig: translate old to modern: I have not deserved this.
target: I have not deserved this.

orig: translate old to modern: Fly further off, my lord, fly further off; Mark Antony is in your tents, my lord; Fly, therefore, noble Cassius, fly far off.
target: Fly further off, my lord, fly further off; Mark Antony is in your tents, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Tomorrow then I will expect your coming.
target: I will see you tomorrow, then.

orig: translate old to modern: And so near will I be That your best friends shall wish I had been further.
target: and so near will I be, That your best friends shall wish I had been further away.

orig: translate old to modern: Let me go with you.
target: Let me go with you.

orig: translate old to modern: Very well.
target: Very well.

orig: translate old to modern: But in your daughter’s womb I bury them, Where, in that nest of spicery, they will breed Selves of themselves, to your recomforture.
target: But in your daughter’s womb I will bury them.

orig: translate old to modern: You must awhile be patient.
target: You must be patient a while.

orig: translate old to modern: Peace, sirrah!
target: Calm down.

orig: translate old to modern: I peace!
target: Me quiet!

orig: translate old to modern: O wicked wall, through whom I see no bliss, Curs'd he thy stones for thus deceiving me!
target: Oh wicked wall, through whom I see no bliss, Cursed be your stones for deceiving me like this!

orig: translate old to modern: Is Caesar yet gone to the Capitol?
target: Has Caesar gone to the Capitol?

orig: translate old to modern: No, truly.
target: Honestly, no.

orig: translate old to modern: Follow!
target: Follow!

orig: translate old to modern: O proud Death, What feast is toward in thine eternal cell That thou so many princes at a shot So bloodily hast struck?
target: O proud death, What feast is being held in your eternal cell, That you have killed so many princes So bloodily all at the same time?

orig: translate old to modern: And I pray thee now tell me, for which of my bad parts didst thou first fall in love with me?
target: Now, tell me—which of my bad qualities did you fall in love with first?

orig: translate old to modern: Come, Grey.
target: Come, Grey.

orig: translate old to modern: Cousin, there's fall'n between him and my lord An unkind breech; but you shall make all well.
target: Cousin, there's an angry break up that’s fallen between him and my lord, but you shall make all well.

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you leave me.
target: Now please leave me alone.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, that's certain.
target: No, that's certain.

orig: translate old to modern: I do beseech you— Chiefly that I might set it in my prayers— What is your name?
target: Please— Chiefly that I might say it in my prayers— What is your name?

orig: translate old to modern: Good night, lieutenant, I must to the watch.
target: Good-night, lieutenant; I must get going to the guard.

orig: translate old to modern: Those uncles which you want were dangerous.
target: Those uncles that you wish were here were dangerous.

orig: translate old to modern: But of that tomorrow, When therewithal we shall have cause of state Craving us jointly.
target: But more of that tomorrow, When together with that matter, we will have political issues That need us jointly.

orig: translate old to modern: Apollo plays, And twenty cagèd nightingales do sing: Or wilt thou sleep?
target: Do you want to sleep?

orig: translate old to modern: And it is marvel he out-dwells his hour, For lovers ever run before the clock.
target: And it’s a wonder that he’s late, Because lovers always keep ahead of the clock.

orig: translate old to modern: But are you so much in love as your rhymes speak?
target: Are you really as in love as your poems declare?

orig: translate old to modern: What wicked and dissembling glass of mine Made me compare with Hermia's sphery eyne?
target: What wicked and lying mirror of mine Made me compare my eyes with Hermia's?

orig: translate old to modern: Thus ornament is but the guiled shore To a most dangerous sea; the beauteous scarf Veiling an Indian beauty; in a word, The seeming truth which cunning times put on To entrap the wisest.
target: Thus decoration is only the deceived shore To a most dangerous sea; the beautiful scarf Veiling an Indian beauty; in a word, The seeming truth which skillful times dress in To fool the wisest men.

orig: translate old to modern: I prithee, take thy fingers from my throat; For, though I am not splenitive and rash, Yet have I in me something dangerous, Which let thy wisdom fear.
target: I beg you, take your fingers from my throat, For, although I am not impatient and rash, I still have something dangerous in me, Which you should fear.

orig: translate old to modern: Anything that’s mended is but patched.
target: Anything that’s mended is only patched up.

orig: translate old to modern: Had I as many sons as I have hairs, I would not wish them to a fairer death.
target: If I had as many sons as I have hairs, I would not wish them to a fairer death.

orig: translate old to modern: I will prophesy he comes to tell me of the players.
target: I predict he comes to tell me of the players, listen.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, let’s all take hands Till that the conquering wine hath steeped our sense In soft and delicate Lethe.
target: Come, let’s join our hands until the overpowering wine makes us soft and forgetful.

orig: translate old to modern: If that her breath will mist or stain the stone, Why then, she lives.
target: If her breath steams up the glass, then she’s alive.

orig: translate old to modern: About it.
target: Let’s go.

orig: translate old to modern: But the great one that goes up the hill, let him draw thee after.
target: But if you see a wheel going uphill, latch on for the ride.

orig: translate old to modern: In your dumps?
target: Are you down in the dumps?

orig: translate old to modern: Art thou thus boldened, man, by thy distress Or else a rude despiser of good manners, That in civility thou seem’st so empty?
target: Are you acting so boldly from hardship or because you despise good manners?

orig: translate old to modern: He sends to know if your pleasure hold to play with Laertes, or that you will take longer time.
target: He want to know if will play with Laertes now, or whether you will take a longer time.

orig: translate old to modern: Let’s tonight Be bounteous at our meal.
target: Tonight let’s have plenty to eat.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, this is my daughter here asleep, And this Lysander, this Demetrius is, This Helena, old Nedar's Helena.
target: My lord, this is my daughter here asleep; And this Lysander; this Demetrius is; This Helena, old Nedar's Helena.

orig: translate old to modern: If there be any impediment, I pray you discover it.
target: If there’s any reason we shouldn’t get married, I urge you to tell me.

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot tell.
target: I don’t remember.

orig: translate old to modern: You see how easily she may be surprised.
target: Be at ease.

orig: translate old to modern: News, my good lord, from Rome.
target: I have news from Rome, my good lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Where nothing, But who knows nothing, is once seen to smile; Where sighs and groans and shrieks that rend the air, Are made, not mark'd; where violent sorrow seems A modern ecstasy.
target: where nothing, But who knows nothing, is once seen to smile, Where sighs, and groans, and shrieks, that tear at the air, Are made, not marked, where violent sorrow seems A modern ecstasy.

orig: translate old to modern: How “seventh cause”?—Good my lord, like this fellow.
target: What do you mean, the seventh cause?

orig: translate old to modern: Leave me, I pray, a little.
target: Just give me a moment, please—only a moment.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou art a fool.
target: You’re a fool.

orig: translate old to modern: Therefore prepare to die.
target: So prepare to die.

orig: translate old to modern: Speak, an if you hear; Speak, of all loves!
target: Speak, if you hear me; Speak, of all loves!

orig: translate old to modern: Once more, adieu.
target: Again, goodbye.

orig: translate old to modern: If I speak like myself in this, let him be whipped that first finds it so.
target: If I’m telling the truth like a fool in saying all this, whip the first person who thinks I sound foolish.

orig: translate old to modern: He shall do this; or else I do recant The pardon that I late pronounced here.
target: He shall do this, or else I take back The pardon that I just pronounced here.

orig: translate old to modern: Then, in the name of God and all these rights, Advance your standards.
target: So, in the name of God and all the good that will come of this

orig: translate old to modern: I will not sleep, my lord, till I have delivered your letter.
target: I won’t sleep until I’ve delivered your letter, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Poor birds they are not set for.
target: Poor birds do not fall down.

orig: translate old to modern: But sure I fear we shall not win him to it.
target: But I’m afraid we’ll never get him to agree to be king.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, as a woodcock to mine own springe, Osric.
target: Why, as a woodpecker caught in my own trap, Osric.

orig: translate old to modern: O Antony, O thou Arabian bird!
target: Oh, Antony!

orig: translate old to modern: Of Mantua.
target: Mantua.

orig: translate old to modern: How now shall this be compassed?
target: How shall this be done?

orig: translate old to modern: I knew it would be your answer.
target: I knew that would be your answer.

orig: translate old to modern: Amen.
target: Amen.

orig: translate old to modern: Your fortunes are alike.
target: Your fortunes are the same.

orig: translate old to modern: I do not desire he should answer for me, and yet I determine to fight lustily for him.
target: I don’t expect him to answer for me, and yet I’m determined to fight vigorously for him.

orig: translate old to modern: Sweet Phoebe, do not scorn me.
target: Sweet Phoebe, do not scorn me.

orig: translate old to modern: Let it work; For 'tis the sport to have the enginer Hoist with his own petar; and ' shall go hard But I will delve one yard below their mines And blow them at the moon.
target: Let it be, Because it’s the sport to have the swordsman Killed with his own sword, and it won’t be easy But I will dig one yard below their mines And blow them at the moon.

orig: translate old to modern: Love is merely a madness and, I tell you, deserves as well a dark house and a whip as madmen do, and the reason why they are not so punished and cured is that the lunacy is so ordinary that the whippers are in love, too.
target: The only reason they don’t get punished and cured is that the disease is so commonplace that the nuthouse nurses are usually suffering from it, too.

orig: translate old to modern: Then must the Jew be merciful.
target: Then must the Jew be merciful.

orig: translate old to modern: Your voice shall be as strong as any man's In the disposing of new dignities.
target: Your voice shall be as strong as any man's In giving out the new honorable offices.

orig: translate old to modern: Advise yourself.
target: Think about it.

orig: translate old to modern: Brief, I recovered him, bound up his wound, And after some small space, being strong at heart,
target: After a brief time—as he is a strong, brave man—

orig: translate old to modern: Put on what weary negligence you please, You and your fellow servants.
target: Be as lazy and neglectful as you like around him—you and the other servants.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, how I long to have some chat with her!
target: I can’t wait to meet her!

orig: translate old to modern: I kiss his dirty shoe, and from heartstring I love the lovely bully.
target: I kiss his dirty shoe, and from the bottom of my heart I love the lovely boy.

orig: translate old to modern: Where is Polonius?
target: Where is Polonius?

orig: translate old to modern: No, ’twas the vane on the house.
target: Just the weathervane moving.

orig: translate old to modern: Is ’t so, my lords of England?
target: Is that true, my lords of England?

orig: translate old to modern: Shall we give o'er and drown?
target: Shall we give up and drown?

orig: translate old to modern: To you, Antonio, I owe the most in money and in love; And from your love I have a warranty To unburthen all my plots and purposes, How to get clear of all the debts I owe.
target: To you, Antonio, I owe the most, in money and in friendship, And, from your friendship, I have a guarantee To get rid of all my plots and intentions as to How to get clear all the debts I owe.

orig: translate old to modern: help, ho!
target: help, ho!

orig: translate old to modern: Women are made to bear, and so are you.
target: Women are made for

orig: translate old to modern: Of what kind should this cock come of?
target: What kind of fighting cock is this?

orig: translate old to modern: Man delights not me—no, nor woman nei- ther, though by your smiling you seem to say so.
target: Man doesn’t delight me, no, nor woman either, though by your smiling, you seem to find that funny.

orig: translate old to modern: Leave me with haste.
target: Leave me quickly.

orig: translate old to modern: Richard loves Richard; that is, I and I.
target: Richard loves Richard, that is, there’s just me and myself here.

orig: translate old to modern: The venom of such looks, we fairly hope, Have lost their quality, and that this day Shall change all griefs and quarrels into love.
target: We hope your poison has worn off and this day shall transform all grievances and quarrels into friendship.

orig: translate old to modern: Most heavy day!
target: It’s a very sad day.

orig: translate old to modern: Or that I had any friend would be a man for my sake!
target: Or had a friend who would be a man for me!

orig: translate old to modern: Well, I will undertake it.
target: OK, I’ll do it.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, in all confidence, he's not for Rhodes.
target: No, in all confidence, the Turks are not going to Rhodes.

orig: translate old to modern: The fellow has good judgment.
target: This messenger is wise.

orig: translate old to modern: My wife!
target: My wife!

orig: translate old to modern: I have laid those sheets you bade me on the bed.
target: I have put on those sheets you asked me to.

orig: translate old to modern: It is enacted in the laws of Venice,— If it be proved against an alien That by direct or indirect attempts He seek the life of any citizen, The party 'gainst the which he doth contrive, Shall seize one half his goods; the other half Comes to the privy coffer of the state; And the offender's life lies in the mercy Of the duke only, 'gainst all other voice.
target: It is enacted in the laws of Venice, That, if it is proved against an alien That by direct or indirect attempts He seek the life of any citizen, The party against whom he schemes Shall seize one half his goods; the other half Comes to the public treasury of the state; And the offender's life lies at the mercy Of the Duke only, above all others.

orig: translate old to modern: If then that friend demand why Brutus rose against Caesar, this is my answer: Not that I loved Caesar less, but that I loved Rome more.
target: If then that friend demands why Brutus rose against Caesar, this is my answer,—Not that I loved Caesar less, but that I loved Rome more.

orig: translate old to modern: I tell thee, man, ’tis better with me now Than when thou met’st me last where now we meet.
target: I tell you, man, it’s better for me, too, than the last time we met here.

orig: translate old to modern: Othello's occupation's gone!
target: Othello's occupation's gone!

orig: translate old to modern: It is judgement maim'd and most imperfect, That will confess perfection so could err Against all rules of nature, I therefore vouch again, That with some mixtures powerful o'er the blood, Or with some dram conjured to this effect, He wrought upon her.
target: I therefore testify again, That he worked on her with some mixtures powerful over the blood, Or with some dram that produced this effect.

orig: translate old to modern: My ancestors did from the streets of Rome The Tarquin drive, when he was call'd a king.
target: My ancestors drove Tarquin from the streets of Rome When he was called a king.— "Speak, strike, revenge!

orig: translate old to modern: I must love you and sue to know you better.
target: I look forward to getting to know you better.

orig: translate old to modern: O Bottom, thou art changed!
target: Oh Bottom, you are changed!

orig: translate old to modern: My advocation is not now in tune; My lord is not my lord, nor should I know him Were he in favor as in humor alter'd.
target: My pleading is out of tune right now; My lord is not my lord; and I wouldn’t know him If he were he in favor as changed in disposition.

orig: translate old to modern: You are three men of sin, whom Destiny, That hath to instrument this lower world And what is in't, the never-surfeited sea Hath caused to belch up you, and on this island Where man doth not inhabit, you ’mongst men Being most unfit to live.
target: You are three men of sin, whom Destiny, That has the power over this lower world And what is in it,—has caused the never-satisfied sea to spit up you; and on this island Where man doesn’t live, you among men Being most unfit to live.

orig: translate old to modern: Knock you here, sir?
target: Moron!

orig: translate old to modern: The old man’s daughter told us all.
target: Leonato’s daughter had told us everything.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor time nor place Did then adhere, and yet you would make both: They have made themselves, and that their fitness now Does unmake you.
target: They have made themselves agree, and that agreement now Doesn’t agree with you.

orig: translate old to modern: Sit.
target: Have a seat.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell her my love, more noble than the world, Prizes not quantity of dirty lands; The parts that fortune hath bestowed upon her, Tell her, I hold as giddily as fortune; But ’tis that miracle and queen of gems That nature pranks her in attracts my soul.
target: Tell her my love is purer than anything else in the whole world, and has nothing to do with her property.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, here is the note of the fashion to testify.
target: Why, here is the order to prove it.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, begin.
target: But come on, start.

orig: translate old to modern: Get you gone, you dwarf; You minimus, of hind'ring knot-grass made; You bead, you acorn.
target: Get going, you dwarf; You zero, made of scraps of grass; You bead, you acorn.

orig: translate old to modern: You have said now.
target: You have said so.

orig: translate old to modern: Do it.
target: Do it now.

orig: translate old to modern: If I owe you anything, I will pay you in cudgels.
target: If I owe you anything, I’ll pay you in clubbings.

orig: translate old to modern: How appears the fight?
target: How goes the battle?

orig: translate old to modern: By this hand, I am.
target: I swear I am.

orig: translate old to modern: I go; and towards three or four o'clock Look for the news that the Guildhall affords.
target: Around three or four o'clock, look for news from the meeting hall.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, then, that’s the humor of ’t.
target: Well, then, that’s how it is.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, then we bring forth weeds When our quick minds lie still, and our ills told us Is as our earing.
target: It’s easy to err when left to our own devices, but criticism helps us to see our faults and correct them.

orig: translate old to modern: I understand not, madam.
target: I don’t know what you mean, madam.

orig: translate old to modern: Very good.
target: Good.

orig: translate old to modern: I have neither the scholar’s melancholy, which is emulation; nor the musician’s, which is fantastical; nor the courtier’s, which is proud; nor the soldier’s, which is ambitious; nor the lawyer’s, which is politic; nor the lady’s, which is nice; nor the lover’s, which is all these, but it is a melancholy of mine own, compounded of many simples, extracted from many objects, and indeed the sundry contemplation of my travels, in which my often rumination wraps me in a most humorous sadness.
target: I don’t have the proud melancholy of a courtier or the ambitious melancholy of a soldier or the calculated melancholy of a lawyer.

orig: translate old to modern: Out o'th’ moon, I do assure thee: I was the man i'th’ moon when time was.
target: Out of the moon, I assure you: I was the Man in the Moon, a long time ago.

orig: translate old to modern: O nuncle, court holy water in a dry house is better than this rainwater out o' door.
target: Oh, uncle, it’s better to smile and flatter indoors where it’s dry than get soaked out here.

orig: translate old to modern: Then forth, dear countrymen.
target: Let’s go forth, dear countrymen.

orig: translate old to modern: Why do you speak, too, “Why blame you me to love you?”?
target: Who are you talking to?

orig: translate old to modern: Why, say they are vile and false; As where's that palace where in to foul things Sometimes intrude not?
target: Why, what if they are vile and false, Where's that palace that foul things sometimes intrude?

orig: translate old to modern: Will you to Scone?
target: Will you be going to Scone?

orig: translate old to modern: Look you here, Here is himself, marr'd, as you see, with traitors.
target: Look here, Here he is, disfigured, as you can see, by traitors.

orig: translate old to modern: I will presently go learn their day of marriage.
target: I’ll go now to find out the date of the wedding.

orig: translate old to modern: Who can be wise, amazed, temperate and furious, Loyal and neutral, in a moment?
target: Who can be wise, amazed, temperate, and furious, Loyal and neutral, in a moment?

orig: translate old to modern: They say Edgar, his banished son, is with the Earl of Kent in Germany.
target: I hear that Edgar, Gloucester’s exiled son, is with the Earl of Kent in Germany.

orig: translate old to modern: Have you your father's leave?
target: Have you your father's permission?

orig: translate old to modern: Cuckold me!
target: Unfaithful to me!

orig: translate old to modern: Is he well shipp'd?
target: Does he have a good ship?

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll serve this duke.
target: I want to be this Duke’s servant.

orig: translate old to modern: Marry, sir, lullaby to your bounty till I come again.
target: Well then, sing a lullaby to your generosity: it’ll nap until I come back.

orig: translate old to modern: But who comes here?
target: But who comes here?

orig: translate old to modern: Forth at your eyes your spirits wildly peep; And, as the sleeping soldiers in the alarm, Your bedded hairs, like life in excrements, Start up and stand on end.
target: Your spirits wildly peep from your eyes, And, as the sleeping soldiers at the alarm, Your bedded hairs, like life in growths, Start up and stand an end.

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, good night; I humbly thank your ladyship.
target: Madam, good night; I humbly thank your ladyship.

orig: translate old to modern: I will kill thee a hundred and fifty ways.
target: I will, in other words, kill you in three hundred and fifty ways.

orig: translate old to modern: Let us sit and mock the good housewife Fortune from her wheel, that her gifts may henceforth be bestowed equally.
target: Let’s go find that hussy, Fortune, and and mock her till she starts distributing her gifts more equally.

target: Are you alive?

target: Can he be angry?

orig: translate old to modern: Swear.
target: Swear.

target: Hello, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: So hath my lord dared him to single fight.
target: So you’ve dared him to single combat.

target: Listen, if you want a good laugh—and I mean a side-splitting one—then follow me.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy conceit is nearer death than thy powers.
target: You’re not as close to death as you think you are.

target: Order his death immediately, And, with the traitor’s former title, greet Macbeth.

target: Ma'am, I’d rather— I know your lady Goneril doesn’t love her husband.

target: Something from Venice, surely.

orig: translate old to modern: The prince my brother hath outgrown me far.
target: The prince has far outgrown me.

target: To have no separation between this part he played And the man he played it for, he had to become the Absolute Duke of Milan.

target: How are you feeling, Malvolio?

target: Madam!

orig: translate old to modern: would she were hearsed at my foot, and the ducats in her coffin!
target: I wish my daughter were dead at my foot, and the jewels in her ear; I wish she were trained at my feet, and the dollars in her coffin!

orig: translate old to modern: Ay me, detested!
target: That’s the truth.

orig: translate old to modern: In both my eyes he doubly sees himself: In each eye, one:—swear by your double self, And there's an oath of credit.
target: In both my eyes, he doubly sees himself, One in each eye; swear by your double self, And there's an oath to believe.

orig: translate old to modern: O, where, my lord?
target: Where, my lord?

orig: translate old to modern: And when I have my meed, I will away, For this will out, and then I must not stay.
target: And when I get my reward, I’ll get out of here.

orig: translate old to modern: Since lion vile hath here deflower'd my dear; Which is—no, no—which was the fairest dame That lived, that loved, that liked, that looked with cheer.
target: Since the vile lion vile has here taken my dear; Which is—no, no—which was the fairest dame That lived, that loved, that liked, that looked with cheer.

orig: translate old to modern: That is another simple sin in you, to bring the ewes and the rams together and to offer to get your living by the copulation of cattle; to be bawd to a bellwether and to betray a she-lamb of a twelvemonth to a crooked-pated old cuckoldly ram, out of all reasonable match.
target: That’s another sin arising from your ignorance: you bring ewes and rams together and make your living by their copulation.

orig: translate old to modern: O Clitus!
target: O Clitus!

orig: translate old to modern: I know no news, my lord.
target: I don’t have any news to report, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Must I speak now?
target: Must I speak now?

orig: translate old to modern: Will you go hear this news, Signior?
target: Will you come with me to hear this news, sir?

orig: translate old to modern: Now fare you well, good sir.
target: Goodbye, good sir.

orig: translate old to modern: And what say’st thou then to my love?
target: So what do you say to my suit?

orig: translate old to modern: O Cleopatra!
target: Oh, Cleopatra!

orig: translate old to modern: Too old by heaven.
target: That’s definitely too old.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy voice is thunder, but thy looks are humble.
target: Your voice is loud and commanding, but you look like a working man.

target: Why couldn’t you be attended by my servants, or by Regan’s?

target: That’s not your fault!

target: Oh Sisters Three, Come, come to me, With hands as pale as milk; Lay them in gore, Since you have shore With shears his thread of silk.

orig: translate old to modern: Why Doth it not then our eyelids sink?
target: Why Doesn’t then make our eyelids close?

target: I’ve heard too much already, because your words and actions don’t agree with each other.

orig: translate old to modern: Your friends are up and buckle on their armor.
target: Your friends are up and buckling on their armor.

orig: translate old to modern: I think ’twas Soto that your Honor means.
target: I believe your Honor is thinking of a character called Soto.

orig: translate old to modern: Belike some noble gentleman that means, Traveling some journey, to repose him here.
target: It’s probably some noble gentleman stopping off in mid-journey, thinking to spend the night here.

target: What do you say to that, Malvolio?

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll after him, and see the event of this.
target: I’ll go too and make sure that happens.

target: Only Adam, Rafe, and Gregory were ready.

target: No, Caesar, we will respond to their attack.

orig: translate old to modern: Stand!
target: Stop!

target: Catesby, fly to the duke.

orig: translate old to modern: Now let’s have a catch.
target: Sing us a song.

orig: translate old to modern: Lechery!
target: Nonsense.

orig: translate old to modern: To which we all appeal.
target: To which we all appeal.

orig: translate old to modern: Where’s my son Edmund?
target: Where’s my son Edmund?

target: Forever and forever goodbye, Brutus!

orig: translate old to modern: I was not angry since I came to France Until this instant.
target: I was not angry since I came to France until this instant.

orig: translate old to modern: Why then, let fall Your horrible pleasure.
target: So go ahead and have your terrifying fun.

orig: translate old to modern: I told you, sir, they were red-hot with drinking; So fun of valour that they smote the air For breathing in their faces, beat the ground For kissing of their feet; yet always bending Towards their project.
target: I told you, sir, they were red-hot with drinking; So full of smoothness that they beat the air For breathing in their faces; beat the ground For kissing their feet; yet always bending Towards their project.

orig: translate old to modern: The will!
target: The will!

orig: translate old to modern: Stand fast, good Fate, to his hanging.
target: Hold your position, good Fate, for his hanging!

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you tell me your remedy.
target: Please, tell me your cure.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, but the clerk that never means to do it, Unless he live until he be a man.
target: Yes, but the clerk that never means to do it, Unless he lives until he is a man.

orig: translate old to modern: Would?
target: Would?

orig: translate old to modern: But, sirrah, mark, we use To say the dead are well.
target: But you know, sirrah, we customarily say that the dead are well.

orig: translate old to modern: A piece of him.
target: A piece of him.

orig: translate old to modern: My matter hath no voice, lady, but to your own most pregnant and vouchsafed ear.
target: My message is not for anyone else to hear, my lady.

orig: translate old to modern: You are welcome.
target: You are welcome.

orig: translate old to modern: O, she tore the letter into a thousand halfpence, railed at herself that she should be so immodest to write to one that she knew would flout her.
target: Oh, she tears that letter into a thousand small pieces and berates herself for being so forward as to write a letter to a man she knows would mock her.

orig: translate old to modern: Where is the fellow?
target: Where is that messenger?

orig: translate old to modern: I, not rememb'ring how I cried out then, Will cry it o'er again: it is a hint That wrings mine eyes to't.
target: I, not remembering how I cried out then, Will cry it out all over again: it is a moment That makes my eyes cry.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou dost not wish more help from England, coz?
target: You don’t wish we had more help from England anymore, cousin?

orig: translate old to modern: Prithee no more!
target: I beg you, no more!

orig: translate old to modern: The beds i’ th’ East are soft, and thanks to you, That called me timelier than my purpose hither, For I have gained by ’t.
target: The East is very seductive.

orig: translate old to modern: Stand, you neat slave, strike!
target: Stand and fight, you overdressed servant, fight!

orig: translate old to modern: Yes, and shall do till the pangs of death shake him.
target: Yes, and he’ll keep getting funnier till he dies.

orig: translate old to modern: For when mine hours Were nice and lucky, men did ransom lives Of me for jests; but now I’ll set my teeth And send to darkness all that stop me.
target: But now I’ll grit my teeth and kill anyone who tries to stop me.

target: I am a villain.

orig: translate old to modern: You, cousin.

target: Farewell.

target: Never, my lord.

target: Do you agree that we shall tell him, Because we love him and it is our duty?

target: Is that true?

orig: translate old to modern: Remember; And call thy husband hither.
target: And I’ll call your husband here.

target: Those charms, your eyes, are erased from my heart; Your bed, lust-stained, shall be spotted with lust's blood.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord?

target: My lord, my lord— I don’t want to hear any more about it.

target: I wonder in my soul What you would ask me to do that I should deny, Or stand so hesitant about.

target: The loss cannot be repaid, and patience Says it is beyond her cure.

target: I repeat, spread the rumor that Anne, my wife, is sick and likely to die.

target: I would rather be a country serving maid than a great queen if it meant I could escape your scorn and constant harassment.

orig: translate old to modern: Let's do't, I pray: and I this morning know Where we shall find him most conveniently.
target: Let's do it, I beg you, and I know exactly Where we shall easily find him.

target: Yes, I’ll grant you that.

orig: translate old to modern: Run barefoot up and down, threatening the flames With bisson rheum; a clout upon that head Where late the diadem stood, and for a robe, About her lank and all o'erteemed loins, A blanket, in the alarm of fear caught up— Who this had seen, with tongue in venom steep'd 'Gainst Fortune's state would treason have pronounced.
target: Run barefoot up and down, threatening the flames With blind tears, a cloth on that head Where lately the crown had stood, and for a robe, About her thin loins, exhausted from child-bearing, A blanket, caught up in the panic of fear, Whoever had seen this, with a very poisoned tongue, Would have pronounced treason against Fortune's state.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, sir, his hide is so tanned with his trade that a will keep out water a great while; and your water is a sore decayer of your whoreson dead body.
target: Why, sir, his hide is so tanned with his trade that he will keep out water a great while, and your water is a sore decayer of your wretched dead body.

orig: translate old to modern: And he did bid us follow to the temple.
target: And he did bid us to follow him to the temple, didn’t he?

target: It’s nine o'clock.

target: But what’s your trade?

target: But what a fool I am to stand here chatting when I should bid good morning to my bride and seal the bargain with a loving kiss.

target: Madam, I will.

target: Her only flaw—and it’s a big one—is that she’s unbearable, a total witch, so much so that I wouldn’t think of marrying her myself, not even if I were in a worse fix than I am, not for a whole goldmine.

target: If I weren’t a merciful man, I’d forget about your missing brother and punish you in his place.

target: By Mary, sir, nose-painting, sleep, and urine.

target: What an excellent idea—he’ll soak up the wine!

target: Didn’t you clearly say “Knock,” “pound,” and “put your fists to work”?

target: I am still A virgin; I have never gone back on my word, Scarcely have wanted what was my own, At no time broke a promise, would not betray The devil to his fellow, and delight More in truth than life.

target: This play is the image of a murder done in Vienna.

target: There’s no clock here in the forest.

orig: translate old to modern: When is the royal day?
target: When should the royal day be?

target: The crowd calls him lord, And, as the world were just beginning now, Old history forgotten, customs not known, They certify and prop up every word, They cry “We choose!

orig: translate old to modern: We would not die in that man’s company That fears his fellowship to die with us.
target: We would not want to die in the company of a man who fears to die with us.

target: So, the man would talk half as much as Benedick and be half as serious as Don John— And if he were handsome, agile, and rich, too, he could have any woman in the world—all he’d need was her good will.

orig: translate old to modern: how now!
target: Come now!

orig: translate old to modern: Titinius' face is upward.
target: Titinius' face is upward.

target: Why don’t you answer me, man?

target: Don’t be afraid of him, Caesar; he's not dangerous; He’s a noble Roman and has a good disposition.

target: God give him health.

target: Work on, My medicine, work!

target: Why, what symptoms of love does she exhibit?

target: Play, trumpets!

target: It’s not yet daylight.

target: Make her sterile and dry up her womb so that no baby will ever come out of her body and honor her.

target: Good morning, Prince; good morning, Claudio.

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot love him.
target: I can’t love him.

orig: translate old to modern: Welcome, my lord.
target: Welcome, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: What news?
target: What news?

orig: translate old to modern: I have been worth the whistle.
target: So you finally find me worthy of your attentions.

orig: translate old to modern: Good time of day unto my gracious lord.
target: Good afternoon, my dear lord!

orig: translate old to modern: Obey thy parents, keep thy word’s justice, swear not, commit not with man’s sworn spouse, set not thy sweet heart on proud array.
target: Obey your parents, keep your word, don’t swear, don’t sleep with another man’s wife, and don’t covet flashy clothes.

orig: translate old to modern: A hundred marks, my Kate does put her down.
target: I’ll bet you a hundred marks, my Kate puts her flat on her back.

orig: translate old to modern: O, but I fear—How lost you company?
target: O, but I fear how lost you each other?

orig: translate old to modern: Things without all remedy Should be without regard.
target: Problems with no solutions Should not be thought about.

orig: translate old to modern: God’s will, I pray thee wish not one man more.
target: In God’s name, I beg you not to wish for one more man.

orig: translate old to modern: Farewell.
target: Goodbye.

orig: translate old to modern: Marry, how?
target: By Mary, how?

orig: translate old to modern: No.
target: No.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet stay awhile, Thou shalt not back till I have borne this corse Into the market-place.
target: Stay here for a bit; You shall not go back until I have carried this corpse Into the market place.

orig: translate old to modern: God keep me so.—Our heralds go with him.
target: God keep me so.—Heralds, go with him.

orig: translate old to modern: Nymph, in thy orisons Be all my sins remembered.
target: Nymph, in your eyes May all my sins be remembered.

orig: translate old to modern: Passion, I see, is catching, for mine eyes, Seeing those beads of sorrow stand in thine, Began to water.
target: Passion, I see, is catching; for my eyes, Seeing those beads of sorrow stand in yours, Began to tear.

target: They who have done this deed are honorable.

target: But mock me gently, dear Kate, because I love you terribly.

orig: translate old to modern: what a sleep were this For your advancement!
target: What a sleep this is For your advancement!

orig: translate old to modern: Aunchient Pistol, I do partly understand your meaning.
target: Discipline must be kept.

orig: translate old to modern: Good repose the while.
target: Good rest in the meantime!

orig: translate old to modern: What is't that moves your Highness?
target: What upsets you, your highness?

orig: translate old to modern: Well thought on.
target: Good idea.

orig: translate old to modern: We will not fail.
target: We’ll be there.

orig: translate old to modern: Send for the man, and ask him.
target: Send for the man and ask him.

orig: translate old to modern: The motion’s good indeed and be it so.— Petruchio, I shall be your
target: I second that

orig: translate old to modern: Ha, it may be I go under that title because I am merry.
target: Maybe they call me that because I am cheerful.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, high or low; Thyself and office deftly show!
target: Come, high or low; Yourself and duties skillfully show!

orig: translate old to modern: So shall you hear Of carnal, bloody and unnatural acts; Of accidental judgments, casual slaughters; Of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause; And, in this upshot, purposes mistook Fall'n on the inventors' heads.
target: So you shall hear Of carnal, bloody and unnatural acts, Of accidental judgments, casual slaughters, Of deaths planned by cunning and false causes, And, in this result, mistaken motives Fallen on the planners' heads.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, for a need, thus far come near my person: Tell them when that my mother went with child Of that insatiate Edward, noble York My princely father then had wars in France, And, by true computation of the time, Found that the issue was not his begot, Which well appearèd in his lineaments, Being nothing like the noble duke my father.
target: And, if you need to, approach the subject of me: tell them that when my mother became pregnant with the insatiable Edward, my noble father was fighting in France.

orig: translate old to modern: How fares my lord?
target: How are you, my lord?

orig: translate old to modern: O Hamlet, what a falling off was there!
target: O Hamlet, what a falling-off there was in our marriage!

orig: translate old to modern: If not the face of men, The sufferance of our souls, the time's abuse— If these be motives weak, break off betimes, And every man hence to his idle bed; So let high-sighted tyranny range on Till each man drop by lottery.
target: If not the face of men, The suffering of our souls, the waste of time— If these motives are weak, let’s break it off now, And every man go away to his lazy rest, Let high-sighted tyranny range on Until each man drops by chance.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, worthy Thane, You do unbend your noble strength, to think So brainsickly of things.
target: Why, worthy baron, You weaken your noble strength to think About things in such a crazy way.

orig: translate old to modern: How didst thou know 'twas she?
target: How did you know it was she?

orig: translate old to modern: Better I were distract— So should my thoughts be severed from my griefs, And woes by wrong imaginations lose The knowledge of themselves.
target: It’d be better to be delirious and unaware of anything.

orig: translate old to modern: Anon he finds him, Striking too short at Greeks.
target: Eventually he finds him, Striking too short at the Greeks.

orig: translate old to modern: With good acceptance of his Majesty— Save that there was not time enough to hear, As I perceived his Grace would fain have done, The severals and unhidden passages Of his true titles to some certain dukedoms, And generally to the crown and seat of France, Derived from Edward, his great-grandfather.
target: Favorably, except that there wasn’t enough time for his Grace to hear, as I sensed he would have liked to, the details about how he is rightfully entitled to certain dukedoms in France, and to the throne of France in general, through clear lines of descent originating with his great-grandfather, Edward III.

orig: translate old to modern: Macduff is missing, and your noble son.
target: Macduff is missing and your noble son.

orig: translate old to modern: Let us go in; And charge us there upon inter'gatories, And we will answer all things faithfully.
target: Let’s go in; And ask us all your questions, And we’ll answer everything truthfully.

orig: translate old to modern: All the world’s a stage, And all the men and women merely players.
target: The whole world is a stage, and all the men and women merely actors.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet touch this sparingly, as ’twere far off, Because, my lord, you know my mother lives.
target: But only hint at this vaguely, because, as you know, my mother’s still alive.

orig: translate old to modern: For thou hast been As one, in suff'ring all, that suffers nothing; A man that Fortune's buffets and rewards Hast ta'en with equal thanks; and blest are those Whose blood and judgment are so well commeddled That they are not a pipe for Fortune's finger To sound what stop she please.
target: Because you have been As one, that in suffering all, that suffers nothing, A man that Fortune's feasts and rewards Have taken with equal thanks, and blessed are those Whose blood and judgment are so well blended That they are not an instrument for Fortune's finger To play whatever song she pleases.

orig: translate old to modern: At your choice, sir.
target: As you wish, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Let him not leave out The color of her hair.
target: Don’t let him leave out the color of her hair.

orig: translate old to modern: We doubt not of a fair and lucky war, Since God so graciously hath brought to light This dangerous treason lurking in our way To hinder our beginnings.
target: I have no doubt that it will be a swift and successful war, since God so graciously exposed this dangerous plot.

orig: translate old to modern: Ha?
target: Yes?

orig: translate old to modern: Bernardo?
target: Bernardo?

orig: translate old to modern: When this advice is free I give and honest, Probal to thinking, and indeed the course To win the Moor again?
target: When this advice I give is free and honest, Calculated to his thinking, and, indeed, the way To win the Moor again?

orig: translate old to modern: Swoons rather, for so bad a prayer as his Was never yet for sleep.
target: No one ever gave a prayer like that before going to sleep.

orig: translate old to modern: I thank you, valiant Cassio.
target: I thank you, valiant Cassio.

orig: translate old to modern: Sweetest nut hath sourest rind; Such a nut is Rosalind.
target: The sweetest nut has the sourest rind And Rosalind is that kind of nut.

orig: translate old to modern: The ocean, overpeering of his list, Eats not the flats with more impetuous haste Than young Laertes, in a riotous head, O'erbears your offices.
target: The ocean, exceeding of his borders, Doesn’t eat the flatlands with more impatient speed Than young Laertes, heading a riot, Takes over your offices.

orig: translate old to modern: Well.
target: Very well.

orig: translate old to modern: But say, my lord, it were not registered, Methinks the truth should live from age to age, As ’twere retailed to all posterity, Even to the general all-ending day.
target: Well, I think that even if it weren’t on record, the truth would be remembered from one generation to the next—all the way to Doomsday.

orig: translate old to modern: Methinks the ground is even.
target: The ground feels flat to me.

orig: translate old to modern: Though the wisdom of nature can reason it thus and thus, yet nature finds itself scourged by the sequent effects.
target: Though science can explain them away, disasters still come after eclipses.

orig: translate old to modern: Will you come presently?
target: Will you come immediately?

orig: translate old to modern: My duty to you both, on equal love, Great kings of France and England.
target: Great kings of France and England, I owe you both equal service and loyalty.

orig: translate old to modern: But I remember now I am in this earthly world, where to do harm Is often laudable, to do good sometime Accounted dangerous folly.
target: Only I remember now that I am in this earthly world, where to do harm Is often praiseworthy, to do good sometime Is a dangerous mistake.

orig: translate old to modern: Idle old man That still would manage those authorities That he hath given away!
target: That useless old man still thinks he can wield all the powers he’s given away.

orig: translate old to modern: in action how like an angel!
target: In action how like an angel!

orig: translate old to modern: Let’s to bed, knight.
target: Let’s go to bed, knight.

orig: translate old to modern: Nothing, neither way.
target: Nothing, neither way.

orig: translate old to modern: Go to; say no more.
target: OK, say no more.

orig: translate old to modern: Hear a little further, And then I'll bring thee to the present business Which now's upon's; without the which this story Were most impertinent.
target: Listen a little bit more, And then I'll bring you to the present situation Which is now here, without which, this story Would be most irrelevant.

orig: translate old to modern: The king doth love you well.
target: The king loves you very much.

orig: translate old to modern: The mighty dukes, Gloucester and Buckingham.
target: The powerful dukes Gloucester and Buckingham.

orig: translate old to modern: I have seen her die twenty times upon far poorer moment.
target: I’ve seen her claim to be dying twenty times before, and for far less reason.

target: But the devil that tempted you gave you no reason why you should commit treason other than to win the name of traitor.

orig: translate old to modern: I care not.
target: Well, that doesn’t worry me.

orig: translate old to modern: Will you pleasure me?
target: Will you make me happy?

orig: translate old to modern: It was a brute part of him to kill so capital a calf there.
target: It was a brute part of him to kill so capital a stupid fellow there.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor shalt not till necessity be served.
target: And you won’t until the needy eat.

orig: translate old to modern: Look you, sir, Inquire me first what Danskers are in Paris, And how, and who, what means, and where they keep, What company, at what expense; and finding By this encompassment and drift of question That they do know my son, come you more nearer Than your particular demands will touch it.
target: Look here, sir, First ask what Danes are in Paris, And how, and who, what means, and where they live, What company, at what expense, and finding, By this talking around and drift of questions, That they who do know my son, come nearer to you Than your particular questions will touch it.

orig: translate old to modern: By the eighth hour.
target: By eight o’clock.

orig: translate old to modern: I will not change my horse with any that treads but on four pasterns.
target: I will not trade my horse for any that walks on four legs.

orig: translate old to modern: Forbear to sleep the nights, and fast the days; Compare dead happiness with living woe; Think that thy babes were sweeter than they were, And he that slew them fouler than he is.
target: Remember your children as being sweeter than they actually were, and think of the man who killed them as worse than he is.

orig: translate old to modern: But yet, madam— I do not like “But yet.” It does allay The good precedence.
target: But yet, madam— I don’t like the sound of “but yet.” It reverses all the good that came before it.

orig: translate old to modern: For first was he contract to Lady Lucy— Your mother lives a witness to that vow— And afterward by substitute betrothed To Bona, sister to the king of France.
target: King Edward was going to marry Lady Lucy—your mother can vouch for that—and then he was betrothed to Bona, the King of France’s sister-in-law.

orig: translate old to modern: I am not of many words, but I thank you.
target: I’m not a man who talks a lot, but I thank you.

target: Kind gentlemen, every day I turn The page, your pains are registered where I can read them.

orig: translate old to modern: You are almost come to part almost a fray.
target: You just missed a fight that was barely avoided.

orig: translate old to modern: My son Came then into my mind, and yet my mind Was then scarce friends with him.
target: I was reminded of my son, even though I despised my son at that time.

orig: translate old to modern: Besides, she uses me with a more exalted respect than anyone else that follows her.
target: Besides, she treats me more respectfully than the other servants.

orig: translate old to modern: No more of that.
target: Let’s not talk about it.

orig: translate old to modern: Beshrew his soul for me!
target: Damn that Toby!

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll not meddle with it.
target: I won’t bother with it.

orig: translate old to modern: Well pray you, father.
target: Pray well, father.

orig: translate old to modern: I did nothing.
target: I did nothing.

orig: translate old to modern: Where is your husband?
target: Where is your husband?

orig: translate old to modern: They are here about the court, And, as I think, they have already order This night to play before him.
target: They are here at the court, And, I think, they are already hired To play before him tonight.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, let me see thee walk!
target: Take a few steps—I want to see you walk.

orig: translate old to modern: That it would please you leave these sad designs To him that hath more cause to be a mourner, And presently repair to Crosby House, Where, after I have solemnly interred At Chertsey monast'ry this noble king And wet his grave with my repentant tears, I will with all expedient duty see you.
target: Please leave it to me to take care of the burial, as I have more reason to mourn than you do.

orig: translate old to modern: Since I am crept in favor with myself, I will maintain it with some little cost.
target: Since I’m suddenly all the rage, it will be worth the cost.

orig: translate old to modern: I love her ten times more than e'er I did.
target: Now I want her more than ever.

orig: translate old to modern: O you mighty gods,  This world I do renounce, and in your sights Shake patiently my great affliction off.
target: Oh, you mighty gods!

orig: translate old to modern: Come, thou gentle day.
target: Welcome, gentle day!

orig: translate old to modern: Is it even so?
target: Is that how it’s going to be?

orig: translate old to modern: Othello, the fortitude of the place is best known to you; and though we have there a substitute of most allowed sufficiency, yet opinion, a sovereign mistress of effects, throws a more safer voice on you.
target: Othello, the strength of the place is best known to you; and although we have there a force that is more than adequate, yet public opinion, a sovereign mistress of effects, say we need a safer voice, like you.

orig: translate old to modern: For me, with sorrow I embrace my fortune.
target: As for me, I embrace my fortune with sorrow.

orig: translate old to modern: Yea, by Mass, that it is.
target: Yes, by God, that it is.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, man?
target: Why, man?

orig: translate old to modern: With duty and desire we follow you.
target: We follow you, because we should and because we want to.

target: You’re a scholar, speak to it, Horatio.

target: I am glad to see you well.

orig: translate old to modern: My brave spirit!
target: My brave spirit!

orig: translate old to modern: It is not madness That I have utt'red.
target: It’s not craziness That I have spoken.

target: His majesty is so concerned about my personal safety that he has ordered them to conduct me to the  You’re being arrested?

target: And request that she come here.

target: If that’s true, he won’t get it back by crying.

orig: translate old to modern: Zounds, I bleed still; I am hurt to the death.
target: Zounds, I bleed still; I am hurt to the death.

orig: translate old to modern: What say’st thou, my fair flower de luce?
target: What do you say, my fair  I do not know dat.

target: I can’t ask you to make my daughter live—that’s impossible—but I beg you both to tell the people of Messina that she was innocent when she died.

orig: translate old to modern: Her obsequies have been as far enlarged As we have warranty.
target: Her funeral rites have been as far enlarged As we can enlarge.

orig: translate old to modern: Is this face Hero’s?
target: Is this face Hero’s?

orig: translate old to modern: I will bestow him, and will answer well The death I gave him.
target: I will hide him, and will answer the death I gave him well.

orig: translate old to modern: To withdraw with you— why do you go about to recover the wind of me, as if you would drive me into a toil?
target: To divert your attention, why do you go about trying to figure me out, as if you’re to pick a fight?

target: How she returns like the spendthrift, With weather-beaten sides and ragged sails, Thin, torn, and destitute by the prostitute wind!

orig: translate old to modern: Thou art rash as fire, to say That she was false.
target: You are impatient as fire, to say That she was false.

target: And when I’m king, remember to ask me for the earldom of Hereford and all the possessions that go with it, which my brother the king used to own.

orig: translate old to modern: I know that we shall have him well to friend.
target: I know that we shall have him as a friend.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou'rt i' the right.
target: You’re right.

orig: translate old to modern: If the heavens had been pleased, would we had so ended!
target: If God had been willing, I wish we had died in the same hour too!

target: You mock me, sir.

target: If I thought, sir, that I was well awake, I'd try to tell you.

target: Listen, but don’t speak to it.

target: Meet me later at the fortress.

target: I think it’s later than that, sir.

target: What worse place can I beg in your love, And still keep my self-respect — Than to be used as you would use your dog?

orig: translate old to modern: I must needs after him, madam, with my letter.
target: I have to follow him and give him the letter.

target: Besides, there’s no king, however pure his cause, who, if it comes to a trial by combat, can rely on using completely blameless soldiers.

target: You guide me on the way that I was going, And show me the instrument I was to use.

orig: translate old to modern: He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town, Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.
target: He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester, where, if you’d like, we can retreat to.

target: There’s Dolabella, who was sent from Caesar.

orig: translate old to modern: Heaven and earth!
target: Heaven and earth!

target: What a three times two ass I was, to take this drunkard for a god, And worship this dull fool!

orig: translate old to modern: Then I'll look up; My fault is past.
target: Then I’ll look up, My sin is committed.

orig: translate old to modern: How is't with you, my lord?
target: How is it with you, my lord?

orig: translate old to modern: God will revenge it.
target: God will revenge it.

orig: translate old to modern: For divers unknown reasons, I beseech you, Grant me this boon.
target: For various reasons that must remain secret, please do this for me.

orig: translate old to modern: Cassio's a proper man.
target: Cassio's a proper man.

orig: translate old to modern: But now in the division of the kingdom, it appears not which of the dukes he values most, for equalities are so weighed that curiosity in neither can make choice of either’s moiety.
target: But the way he’s divided the kingdom recently, nobody can tell which of the dukes he favors more.

orig: translate old to modern: For many miles about There’s scarce a bush.
target: There’s hardly a bush for miles around.

target: Can you work in the earth so fast?

orig: translate old to modern: Lives my sweet son?
target: Dear son, you’re alive!

orig: translate old to modern: To bait fish withal: if it will feed nothing else, it will feed my revenge.
target: To bait fish with: if it feeds nothing else, it will feed my revenge.

orig: translate old to modern: Plucks off my beard and blows it in my face?
target: Plucks off my beard and blows it in my face?

orig: translate old to modern: O cursed spite, That ever I was born to set it right!
target: O cursed spite, That ever I was born to set it right!

orig: translate old to modern: I am not married, Caesar.
target: It’s true I’m not married, Caesar.

orig: translate old to modern: Indeed, my lord, you made me believe so.
target: Indeed, my lord, you made me believe so.

orig: translate old to modern: O dainty duck!
target: Oh dainty duck!

orig: translate old to modern: If she deny to wed, I’ll crave the day When I shall ask the banns and when be marrièd.
target: If she refuses my proposal, I’ll tell her how much I’m looking forward to the announcement and the wedding.

orig: translate old to modern: Out, and alas!
target: Out, and alas!

orig: translate old to modern: God and his angels guard your sacred throne And make you long become it.
target: May God and his angels guard your sacred throne and grant that you dignify it for a long time.

orig: translate old to modern: Lower, lower!
target: Lower, lower!

orig: translate old to modern: Prithee, peace.
target: Please, let’s not talk about it.

orig: translate old to modern: As I suck blood, I will some mercy show.
target: As I get to leech him, I will show some mercy.

orig: translate old to modern: If I find a hole in his coat, I will tell him my mind.
target: If I find an opportunity, I will give him a piece of my mind.

orig: translate old to modern: My powers are crescent, and my auguring hope Says it will come to th’ full.
target: My forces are growing, and everything I know tells me it’s all coming together.

orig: translate old to modern: If you thrive well, bring them to Baynard’s Castle, Where you shall find me well accompanied With reverend fathers and well-learnèd bishops.
target: If things go well, bring the crowd to  I’m off.

orig: translate old to modern: This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace, That inward breaks, and shows no cause without Why the man dies.
target: This is the abscess of much wealth and peace, That breaks inward, and shows no damage until The man dies.

orig: translate old to modern: Call in the messengers.
target: Call in the messengers and we’ll find out.

orig: translate old to modern: Naughty lady, These hairs which thou dost ravish from my chin Will quicken and accuse thee.
target: Wicked woman, these white hairs you’re pulling off my chin will come to life and accuse you of wrong-doing.

orig: translate old to modern: I thank thee.
target: Thank you.

orig: translate old to modern: Edmund is dead, my lord.
target: Edmund is dead, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: We shall have a rare letter from him: but you’ll not deliver ’t?
target: But you’re not going to deliver it, are you?

orig: translate old to modern: Stir not until the signal.
target: Don’t move until the signal.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, how now, daughter Katherine?
target: Now, daughter Katherine?

orig: translate old to modern: When the mind’s free, The body’s delicate.
target: When your mind is at peace, your body is sensitive to the elements.

orig: translate old to modern: No, I will not cast away my physic but on those that are sick.
target: No, I won’t give my medicine away to anyone but the sick.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, would not you?
target: Why, wouldn’t you?

orig: translate old to modern: Good madam, patience.
target: Good madam, be patient.

orig: translate old to modern: If you did, I care not.
target: If you did, I don’t care.

orig: translate old to modern: Show!
target: Show!

orig: translate old to modern: Did he not rather Discredit my authority with yours, And make the wars alike against my stomach, Having alike your cause?
target: He rejected my authority as much as yours.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet, forgive me, God, That I do brag thus.
target: But God forgive me for bragging.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis certain then for Cyprus.
target: It is certain, then, for Cyprus.

orig: translate old to modern: Hear me, recreant!
target: Listen to me, you traitor.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, that’s all one.
target: Well, that’s the same thing.

orig: translate old to modern: Go to the pulpit, Brutus.
target: Go ahead to the square, Brutus.

orig: translate old to modern: What are you?
target: What are you?

orig: translate old to modern: When shall we come to th' top of that same hill?
target: When will we get to the top of that cliff?

orig: translate old to modern: Should be”—should buzz!
target: Should be?

orig: translate old to modern: What is his name?
target: What’s his name?

orig: translate old to modern: And why not the swift foot of time?
target: Why didn’t you say “the swift steps” of time instead of the “lazy foot”?

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, I hold my life as dear as you do yours, And never in my days, I do protest, Was it so precious to me as ’tis now.
target: My lord, my life is as important to me as yours is to you, and it was never as precious to me as it is now.

orig: translate old to modern: Is this well done?
target: Is this well done?

orig: translate old to modern: No, sir, their hats are pluck'd about their ears, And half their faces buried in their cloaks, That by no means I may discover them By any mark of favor.
target: No, sir, their hats are drawn over their ears, And half their faces are buried in their cloaks, So that I couldn’t tell from their clothes or faces Who any of them are.

orig: translate old to modern: Think, when we talk of horses, that you see them Printing their proud hoofs i' th' receiving earth, For ’tis your thoughts that now must deck our kings, Carry them here and there, jumping o'er times,
target: Imagine, when we talk of horses, that you see them planting their proud hooves in the soft earth.

orig: translate old to modern: He did in some sort, indeed, handle women, but then he was rheumatic, and talked of the Whore of Babylon.
target: He did touch on women a bit, but his body was aching with fever and he talked about the Whore of Babylon.

orig: translate old to modern: Mine was not bridled.
target: Mine wasn’t wearing a bridle.

orig: translate old to modern: I know no touch of it, my lord.
target: I don’t know how to play it, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Name him.
target: Name him.

orig: translate old to modern: Will you withdraw?
target: Will you leave and hide?

orig: translate old to modern: Well aimed of such a young one.
target: You know, you’re right.

orig: translate old to modern: Saint Valentine is past; Begin these wood-birds but to couple now?
target: Saint Valentine’s Day is past; Do these forest-birds begin only now to make a couple?

orig: translate old to modern: But, tell me, where is princely Richmond now?
target: But, tell me, where is the noble Richmond now?

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot tell wat is dat.
target: I don’t understand all dat.

orig: translate old to modern: God bless your Grace!
target: God bless your Grace!

orig: translate old to modern: Honest, my lord?
target: Honest, my lord!

orig: translate old to modern: Or o' mine either?
target: And I too?

orig: translate old to modern: Where is he?
target: Where is this man?

orig: translate old to modern: Tut, fear not me.
target: Don’t worry about me.

orig: translate old to modern: He did, from first to last.
target: He did, from first to last.

orig: translate old to modern: I knew him, Horatio: a fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy.
target: I knew him, Horatio, a fellow of infinite fun, of most excellent imagination.

orig: translate old to modern: Therefore be out of hope, of question, of doubt; Be certain, nothing truer; 'tis no jest That I do hate thee and love Helena.
target: Therefore be out of hope, of question, doubt, Be certain, nothing truer; it’s no joke That I do hate you and love Helena.

orig: translate old to modern: His Honor and myself are at the one, And at the other is my good friend Catesby, Where nothing can proceed that toucheth us Whereof I shall not have intelligence.
target: While he and I are at one, my loyal servant Catesby will be at the other, so nothing will happen that we won’t find out about.

orig: translate old to modern: You would play upon me; you would seem to know my stops; you would pluck out the heart of my mystery; you would sound me from my lowest note to the top of my compass; and there is much music, excellent voice, in this little organ, yet cannot you make it speak.
target: You would play me, you would seem to know my holes to cover, you want to pick out the heart of my mystery, you would sound me from my lowest note to the my highest note, and there is much music, excellent voice, in this little pipe, yet you can’t play it.

orig: translate old to modern: To vouch this, is no proof, Without more certain and more overt test Than these thin habits and poor likelihoods Of modern seeming do prefer against him.
target: To testify is not proof, Without wider and more open tests Than these thin habits and poor probabilities Of modern liking prefer against him.

orig: translate old to modern: Tyrants themselves wept when it was reported.
target: Tyrants themselves wept when they heard about it.

orig: translate old to modern: Not Cassio kill'd!
target: Cassio not killed!

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, they are not yet; But there is come a messenger before, To signify their coming.
target: Madam, not yet; But there is come a messenger ahead of them, To show that they are coming.

orig: translate old to modern: Go but apart, Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will, And they shall hear and judge 'twixt you and me.
target: Step aside, Choose whichever of your wisest friends you want, And they shall hear and judge between you and me.

orig: translate old to modern: Thoughts speculative their unsure hopes relate, But certain issue strokes must arbitrate; Towards which, advance the war.
target: Speculation only tells about their unsure hopes; Only a certain outcome must settle Which direction the war will take.

orig: translate old to modern: I have lost my hopes.
target: I have lost my hopes.

orig: translate old to modern: Go, girl.
target: Go, daughter.

orig: translate old to modern: In thy foul throat thou liest.
target: You’re lying.

orig: translate old to modern: Are you not Kent?
target: Aren’t you Kent?

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll signify so much unto him straight.
target: I’ll tell him right away, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Proof enough to misuse the Prince, to vex Claudio, to undo Hero, and kill Leonato.
target: Evidence enough to deceive the Prince, anger Claudio, ruin Hero, and kill Leonato.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll not be strucken, my lord.
target: I won’t be hit, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: This skull hath lain in the earth three and twenty years.
target: This skull has been buried three-and-twenty years.

orig: translate old to modern: To no more Will I give place or notice.
target: I won’t lodge any more than that under my roof.

orig: translate old to modern: Is not that he?
target: Isn’t that he?

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, be sick, great greatness, And bid thy ceremony give thee cure!
target: Try being sick, great greatness, and see if ceremony can cure you!

orig: translate old to modern: Go, prepare for dinner.
target: Now go, set up for dinner.

orig: translate old to modern: O cruel!
target: Oh, so cruel!

orig: translate old to modern: One word more.
target: Oh!

orig: translate old to modern: I am sure, sweet Kate, this kindness merits thanks.
target: I am sure, sweet Kate, this kindness deserves thanks.

orig: translate old to modern: Forgot you!
target: Forgotten you!

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll go with you.
target: I’ll come soon.

orig: translate old to modern: Now Antony must leave her utterly.
target: Now Antony has to leave her completely.

orig: translate old to modern: To what, my love, shall I compare thine eyne?
target: What, my love, shall I compare your eyes to?

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, Caesar, but not gone.
target: Yes, Caesar, but not gone.

orig: translate old to modern: I took thee for thy better.
target: I mistook you for the King.

orig: translate old to modern: I do serve you in this business.
target: I’ll help you through this business.

orig: translate old to modern: O, she would laugh me Out of myself, press me to death with wit.
target: She’d laugh me right out of my body and kill me with her wit.

orig: translate old to modern: to Alonso] Sir, you may thank yourself for this [to Alonso] Sir, you may thank yourself for this great loss, That would not bless our Europe with your daughter, But rather lose her to an African, Where she, at least, is banished from your eye, Who hath cause to wet the grief on't.
target: Sir, you may thank yourself for this great loss, Since you wouldn’t bless our Europe with your daughter, But would rather marry her to an African; Where she is, at least, out of your sight, You who has cause to shed tears about it.

orig: translate old to modern: O, banish me, my lord, but kill me not!
target: O, banish me, my lord, but don’t kill me!

orig: translate old to modern: Speak, hands, for me!
target: Speak, hands, for me!

orig: translate old to modern: No, Cassio is not kill'd.
target: No, Cassio is not killed.

orig: translate old to modern: The table's full.
target: The table's full.

orig: translate old to modern: That's very true, my lord.
target: That's very true, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Unfought withal, but I will sell my dukedom To buy a slobb'ry and a dirty farm In that nook-shotten isle of Albion.
target: If they march along unopposed, I will sell my dukedom for a sodden, filthy farm in that craggy isle of Albion.

orig: translate old to modern: No hope that way is Another way so high a hope that even Ambition cannot pierce a wink beyond, But doubt discovery there.
