target: The raven himself is hoarse With croaking about the fatal entrance of Duncan Under my castle walls.

orig: translate old to modern: You have done well by water.
target: You’ve done well at sea.

orig: translate old to modern: Fore God, an excellent song.
target: Before God, an excellent song.

orig: translate old to modern: Who is it that complains unto the king That I, forsooth, am stern and love them not?
target: Which of you has been complaining to the king that I don’t like them?

orig: translate old to modern: I will rather sue to be despised than to deceive so good a commander with so slight, so drunken, and so indiscreet an officer.
target: I will rather seek to be despised than to deceive so good a commander with so slight, so drunken, and so indiscreet an officer.

orig: translate old to modern: Dorset, embrace him.—Hastings, love Lord Marquess.
target: Dorset, embrace Hastings.—Hastings, express your affection for the marquess of Dorset.

orig: translate old to modern: O most happy hour!
target: Oh most happy hour!

orig: translate old to modern: And they are gone.
target: And now they’re both gone.

orig: translate old to modern: If that be all, masters, I hear no harm.
target: If that’s all, gentlemen, I see no problem.

orig: translate old to modern: Mend your speech a little, Lest you may mar your fortunes.
target: Revise your statement, or you may damage your inheritance.

orig: translate old to modern: A king, a king!
target: He’s a king, a king!

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, here comes my lord.
target: Ma'am, my master’s coming.

orig: translate old to modern: But all the charms of love, Salt Cleopatra, soften thy wanned lip!
target: Lecherous Cleopatra, may all the charms of love soften those withered lips!

orig: translate old to modern: Where art thou?
target: Where are you?

orig: translate old to modern: Then if he says he loves you, It fits your wisdom so far to believe it As he in his particular act and place May give his saying deed; which is no further Than the main voice of Denmark goes withal.
target: Then if he says he loves you, You would be wise to believe it Because then being in his particular act and place May do what he says, which is what The majority of people in of Denmark go along with.

orig: translate old to modern: A good wench; give it me.
target: A good wench; give it to me.

orig: translate old to modern: Thine eyes, sweet lady, have infected mine.
target: Your beautiful eyes, sweet lady, have infected mine with love.

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you stand good father to me now.
target: I hope you’ll be a good father to me now.

orig: translate old to modern: Withdraw, my lord.
target: Get off the field, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: He was a man, take him for all in all; I shall not look upon his like again.
target: He was a man, take him for all in all, I shall not look upon his like again.

orig: translate old to modern: It is impossible you should see this Were they as prime as goats, as hot as monkeys, As salt as wolves in pride, and fools as gross As ignorance made drunk.
target: It is impossible that you should see this If they were as prime as goats, as hot as monkeys, As salty as wolves in a pride, and fools as disgusting As ignorance made drunk.

orig: translate old to modern: But he that will believe all that they say shall never be saved by half that they do.
target: But if you believe everything they say, you won’t be saved by half of what they do.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, we will slink away in supper-time, Disguise us at my lodging, and return, All in an hour.
target: No, we’ll slink away at suppertime, Disguise ourselves at my house, and return All in an hour.

orig: translate old to modern: And never could maintain his part but in the force of his will.
target: Or in the power of reason.

orig: translate old to modern: The strings, my lord, are false.
target: The strings, my lord, are false.

orig: translate old to modern: Spoke like an officer!
target: Well said!

orig: translate old to modern: Is this the madman?
target: Is this the madman?

orig: translate old to modern: If Cassio do remain, He hath a daily beauty in his life That makes me ugly; and besides, the Moor May unfold me to him; there stand I in much peril: No, he must die.
target: If Cassio lives, He has a daily beauty in his life That makes me ugly; and besides, the Moor May disclose me to him; I stand there in great danger; No, he must die.

orig: translate old to modern: O, relation Too nice, and yet too true!
target: O, kinsman Too nice, and yet too true!

orig: translate old to modern: weeping] I am a fool [weeping] I am a fool To weep at what I am glad of.
target: I am a fool To cry at what I am happy about.

orig: translate old to modern: I know that voice.
target: I know that voice.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou turn'st mine eyes into my very soul, And there I see such black and grained spots As will not leave their tinct.
target: You turn my eyes into my very soul, And there I see such black and grainy spots As will not leave their color.

orig: translate old to modern: There are some shrewd contents in yon same paper, That steals the colour from Bassanio's cheek; Some dear friend dead; else nothing in the world Could turn so much the constitution Of any constant man.
target: There are some harsh contents in that letter That steal the color from Bassanio's cheeks: Some dear friend is dead, or nothing else in the world Could change the constitution so much Of any constant man.

orig: translate old to modern: O you hard hearts, you cruel men of Rome, Knew you not Pompey?
target: O you hard hearts, you cruel men of Rome, Didn’t you know Pompey?

orig: translate old to modern: Peace, peace!
target: Quiet, quiet!

orig: translate old to modern: Why, this it is when men are ruled by women.
target: Well, this is what happens when men let themselves be ruled by women.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis a lost fear: Man but a rush against Othello's breast, And he retires.
target: It is a lost fear; Man can only rush against Othello's breast, And he retires.

orig: translate old to modern: By'r lady, your ladyship is nearer to heaven than when I saw you last by the altitude of a chopine.
target: By our lady, your ladyship is taller than when I saw you last, by the height of a high-heeled shoe.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll go arm myself.
target: I’ll go put my armor on.

orig: translate old to modern: She is of so free, so kind, so apt, so blessed a disposition, she holds it a vice in her goodness not to do more than she is requested.
target: She is so free, so kind, so proper, so blessed a disposition, she holds it a sin in her goodness not to do more than she is asked.

orig: translate old to modern: So, so.
target: So, so.

orig: translate old to modern: Eros, Wouldst thou be windowed in great Rome and see Thy master thus with pleached arms, bending down His corrigible neck, his face subdued To penetrative shame, whilst the wheeled seat Of fortunate Caesar, drawn before him, branded His baseness that ensued?
target: Eros, would you like to look through a window in Rome and watch your master marching in Caesar’s victory parade, his arms crossed and tied, his head bowed in submission, his face red from shame, while the chariot of triumphant Caesar precedes him, putting the final stamp to his humiliation?

orig: translate old to modern: Our fortune on the sea is out of breath And sinks most lamentably.
target: The battle on the sea is almost lost.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, 'tis found so.
target: Why, that’s the coroner’s finding.

orig: translate old to modern: How wilt thou do for a father?
target: How will you do for a father?

orig: translate old to modern: Very well.
target: Very well.

orig: translate old to modern: Even so?
target: Even so?

orig: translate old to modern: What it is, my Caius, I shall unfold to thee, as we are going To whom it must be done.
target: What it is, my Caius, I’ll tell you, as we are walking, As to whom it must be done.

orig: translate old to modern: Your bedchamber.
target: Your bedroom.

orig: translate old to modern: He speaks well.
target: He speaks well.

orig: translate old to modern: Is not that neighborly?
target: Isn’t that enough?

orig: translate old to modern: In such a night, Medea gather'd the enchanted herbs That did renew old Æson.
target: In such a night Medea gathered the enchanted herbs That renewed old Aeson.

orig: translate old to modern: Come hither, my dear Hamlet, sit by me.
target: Come hear, my dear Hamlet, sit by me.

orig: translate old to modern: Here comes my noble gull-catcher.
target: Here she comes, the brilliant fool-catcher.

orig: translate old to modern: Dwell I but in the suburbs Of your good pleasure?
target: Do I only live outside Of your good pleasure?

orig: translate old to modern: When saw you my father last?
target: When was the last time you saw my father?

orig: translate old to modern: And I remember the wooing of a peascod instead of her, from whom I took two cods and, giving her them again, said with weeping tears, “Wear these for my sake.” We that are true lovers run into strange capers.
target: I remember wooing a pea plant in her name, and then taking two pea pods and begging her to wear them “for my sake.” Those of us who are really in love will do the strangest things.

orig: translate old to modern: Look where it comes again!
target: Look it’s coming again!

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, I beseech you, sir, be not out with me; yet, if you be out, sir, I can mend you.
target: No, Please, sir, don’t be angry with me; yet, if you’re angry, sir, I can mend you.

orig: translate old to modern: My mother!
target: My mother.

orig: translate old to modern: I prithee, when thou seest that act afoot, Even with the very comment of thy soul Observe my uncle.
target: I beg you, when you see that act begin, Even with the very criticism of your soul Watch my uncle.

orig: translate old to modern: Maintain a mourning ostentation, And on your family’s old monument Hang mournful epitaphs and do all rites That appertain unto a burial.
target: Make a bug show of mourning for her, hang sad epitaphs up at your family’s tomb, and perform all the appropriate burial ceremonies.

orig: translate old to modern: to Gonzalo] First, noble friend, [to Gonzalo] First, noble friend, Let me embrace thine age, whose honour cannot Be measured or confined.
target: First, noble friend, Let me embrace you, whose honor can’t Be measured or confined.

orig: translate old to modern: Our worser thoughts heavens mend.
target: May heaven save us from indecent thoughts!

orig: translate old to modern: He said mine eyes were black and my hair black And, now I am remembered, scorned at me.
target: He said my eyes and my hair were black and, now that I think of it, he scorned me.

orig: translate old to modern: You beastly knave, know you no reverence?
target: Don’t you have any manners, you savage?

orig: translate old to modern: If by direct or by collateral hand They find us touch'd, we will our kingdom give, Our crown, our life, and all that we call ours, To you in satisfaction; but if not, Be you content to lend your patience to us, And we shall jointly labour with your soul To give it due content.
target: If they find that we killed your father or had him killed, We will surrender our kingdom, Our crown, our life, and all that we call ours, To you in satisfaction, but if not, You must be patient with us, And we shall work together with your soul To give it just compensation.

orig: translate old to modern: Then ’tis most like The sovereignty will fall upon Macbeth.
target: Then it is most likely that The crown will fall upon Macbeth.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, he is gone indeed.
target: Oh, he’s really gone.

orig: translate old to modern: Shall we be sundered?
target: Will we be separated?

orig: translate old to modern: He is much changed.
target: He is very changed.

orig: translate old to modern: No, that were pity; I would entreat you rather to put on Your boldest suit of mirth, for we have friends That purpose merriment.
target: No, that would be a pity; I would beg you rather to put on Your boldest face of happiness, because we have friends That offer merriment.

orig: translate old to modern: Why will My lord do so?
target: Why do you want to do that, my lord?

orig: translate old to modern: Did you perceive how he laughed at his vice?
target: Did you see how he laughed at his sin?

orig: translate old to modern: I shall break The cause of our expedience to the Queen And get her leave to part.
target: I’ll tell the Queen the reason for our quick departure and get her permission to leave.

orig: translate old to modern: This would have seemed a period To such as love not sorrow, but another To amplify too much would make much more And top extremity.
target: This may have seemed like the pinnacle of sadness, but if I went on I could outdo it.

orig: translate old to modern: Or if thou hast not sat as I do now, Wearying thy hearer in thy mistress’s praise, Thou hast not loved.
target: Or if you haven’t sat as I do now, boring your listener with all your lover’s virtues, then you haven’t loved.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, say so, and so be!
target: Oh, say it, and mean it!

orig: translate old to modern: Sure, I think so, And therefore certainly it were not good She knew his love, lest she make sport at it.
target: It would be bad if she knew about Benedick’s love and teased him about it.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, now thou diest as bravely as Titinius, And mayst be honor'd, being Cato's son.
target: Why, now you die as bravely as Titinius, And may be honored, being Cato's son.

orig: translate old to modern: Away, then!
target: Away, then!

orig: translate old to modern: Faith, her privates we.
target: God, we are her privates.

orig: translate old to modern: I shall, my lord.
target: Yes, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Pardon, my lord.
target: Pardon, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: We must die, Messala.
target: We must die, Messala.

orig: translate old to modern: More wonderful, when angels are so angry.
target: It’s even stranger when an angel is so angry.

orig: translate old to modern: I like him very well.
target: I like him very well.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me now leave to leave thee.
target: You may leave.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou liest.
target: You lie.

orig: translate old to modern: Till then sit still, my soul.
target: Until then, sit still, my soul.

orig: translate old to modern: What shall I do?
target: What shall I do?

orig: translate old to modern: And now forward with thy tale.
target: Now get on with your story.

orig: translate old to modern: A pickaxe and a spade, a spade, For and a shrouding sheet; O, a Pit of clay for to be made For such a guest is meet.
target: A pickaxe and a spade, a spade, For and a shrouding sheet, Oe a pit of clay for to be made For such a guest is ptoper.

orig: translate old to modern: How now, Captain Macmorris, have you quit the mines?
target: Tell me, Captain Macmorris, have you left the tunnels?

orig: translate old to modern: Hear you, my lords—     We have some haste, Leonato.
target: Listen, my lords— We’re in a bit of a hurry, Leonato.

orig: translate old to modern: Take up her bed And bear her women from the monument.
target: Pick up her bed and carry her ladies out of the tomb.

orig: translate old to modern: Sweet Prince, you learn me noble thankfulness.— There, Leonato, take her back again.
target: There, Leonato, take your daughter back.

orig: translate old to modern: There.
target: Here.

orig: translate old to modern: And for their sake, In your fair minds let this acceptance take.
target: With those plays in mind, we hope you’ll receive this one kindly.

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot speak to her, yet she urged conference.
target: I can’t speak to her, even though she asked me to.

orig: translate old to modern: Look, here I have you.
target: See, now I have you.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll apprehend him.
target: I’ll arrest him.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, they stay for you to give your daughter to her husband.
target: My lord, they’re waiting for you to give your daughter away to Claudio.

orig: translate old to modern: Now counterfeit to swoon, why, now fall down; Or if thou canst not, Oh, for shame, for shame, Lie not, to say mine eyes are murderers.
target: Faint, fall down—if you don’t, then you’re lying about my eyes being murderers.

orig: translate old to modern: Go, by this token.
target: By this token, you’ll be admitted to their cell.

orig: translate old to modern: Then bring me to their sights.
target: So take me to see them.

orig: translate old to modern: Fly?
target: Flee?

orig: translate old to modern: I do believe 'twas he.
target: I do believe it was he.

orig: translate old to modern: Now will I question Cassio of Bianca, A housewife that by selling her desires Buys herself bread and clothes.
target: Now I will question Cassio about Bianca, A housewife that, by selling her desires, Buys herself bread and clothes.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis dangerous to be spoken.
target: It’s dangerous to talk about it.

orig: translate old to modern: I do believe it Against an oracle.
target: I would believe it Against a fortuneteller.

orig: translate old to modern: Here is his Majesty.
target: Here is his Majesty.

orig: translate old to modern: Me, poor man, my library Was dukedom large enough: of temporal royalties He thinks me now incapable; confederates— So dry he was for sway—with the King of Naples To give him annual tribute, do him homage, Subject his coronet to his crown, and bend The dukedom, yet unbowed alas, poor Milan!— To most ignoble stooping.
target: For me, poor man—my library Was dukedom large enough: now he believes that I am Incapable of performing my political duties; he makes an alliance,— He was so hungry for power,—with the King of Naples To give Naples annual protection money, pledge allegiance, Surrender his small crown to Naples’ crown, and bend The dukedom, which had never bowed before—alas, poor Milan!— To most dishonorable bowing.

orig: translate old to modern: Then will I come to my mother by and by.
target: Then I will go to my mother by and by.

orig: translate old to modern: It is too late.
target: It is too late.

orig: translate old to modern: Early tomorrow will we rise and hence.
target: We will rise early tomorrow, and be on our way.

orig: translate old to modern: The wonder is he hath endured so long.
target: What’s amazing is how long he lasted.

orig: translate old to modern: His reared arm Crested the world.
target: When he raised his arm in command, the world trembled.

orig: translate old to modern: Let life be short, else shame will be too long.
target: Let life be short so that shame won’t last too long.

orig: translate old to modern: It was mere foolery; I did not mark it.
target: It was merely a joke; I didn’t pay attention to it.

orig: translate old to modern: What likelihood of his amendment, lords?
target: What are the chances of his getting better, lords?

orig: translate old to modern: All strange and terrible events are welcome, But comforts we despise.
target: Strange and terrible events are all welcome, but I despise comforts.

orig: translate old to modern: Here's a farmer that hanged himself on th’ expectation of plenty.
target: It must be a farmer that hanged himself on the expectation of a large crop.

orig: translate old to modern: You see how full of changes his age is.
target: He’s so flighty in his old age, as we keep noticing.

orig: translate old to modern: He doth nothing but frown; as who should say, An you will not have me, choose; he hears merry tales, and smiles not: I fear he will prove the weeping philosopher when he grows old, being so full of unmannerly sadness in his youth.
target: He doesn’t do a thing but frown, as someone would say, “If you will not have me, choose.” He hears happy tales and doesn’t smile: I’m afraid he will probably be the weeping philosopher when he grows old, being so full of rude sadness in his youth.

orig: translate old to modern: I know not what you mean by that, but I am sure Caesar fell down.
target: I don’t know what you mean by that, but I’m sure Caesar fell down.

orig: translate old to modern: I will make your peace with him if I can.
target: I’ll try to calm him down for you if I can.

orig: translate old to modern: This seen, Orlando did approach the man And found it was his brother, his elder brother.
target: He discovered that the man was his older brother.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis Banquo's then.
target: Then it’s Banquo's.

orig: translate old to modern: The poison of that lies in you to temper.
target: That part is up to you.

orig: translate old to modern: Good night, sweet prince, And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest!
target: Good night, sweet prince, And flights of angels sing you to your rest!

orig: translate old to modern: Tis noble Kent, your friend.
target: It’s noble Kent, your friend.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, let her except, before excepted.
target: Well, she can get used to it.

orig: translate old to modern: Do not talk of him But as a property.
target: Don’t talk of him Except as a property.

orig: translate old to modern: Say “a day” without the “ever.” No, no, Orlando, men are April when they woo, December when they wed. Maids are May when they are maids, but the sky changes when they are wives.
target: No, Orlando, men are like April when they’re wooing a girl—young, and passionate—but like December once they’re married and their passions have cooled.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, he's going to his mother's closet.
target: My lord, he's going to his mother's bedroom.

orig: translate old to modern: I must perforce.
target: I have no choice.

orig: translate old to modern: And therefore, I pray thee, news.
target: So tell me what’s been going on.

orig: translate old to modern: Pursue him and entreat him to a peace.
target: Go after him and try to calm him down a little.

orig: translate old to modern: Let me have audience for a word or two.
target: Let me have your attention for a moment.

orig: translate old to modern: Have we devils here?
target: Do we have devils here?

orig: translate old to modern: Good then, Casca.
target: Good then, Casca.

orig: translate old to modern: A guiltless death I die.
target: I die an innocent death.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou art a boil, A plague-sore or embossèd carbuncle In my corrupted blood.
target: You’re a pustule, a sore, a tumor digesting my bloodline.

orig: translate old to modern: Now will I go to take some privy order To draw the brats of Clarence out of sight, And to give order that no manner of person Have any time recourse unto the princes.
target: Now I’ll go inside and write out a secret order to keep Clarence’s brats out of sight and to forbid anyone whatsoever from seeing King Edward’s sons.

orig: translate old to modern: No, as I shall be saved.
target: No, as I shall be saved.

orig: translate old to modern: Am not I your Rosalind?
target: Aren’t I your Rosalind?

orig: translate old to modern: I have not seen such a firago.
target: I’ve never seen such a monster.

orig: translate old to modern: There's more depends on this than on the value.
target: There's more that depends on this ring than its value.

orig: translate old to modern: Now he denies it faintly and laughs it out.
target: Now he denies it faintly and laughs it out.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou art a soul in bliss, but I am bound Upon a wheel of fire, that mine own tears Do scald like molten lead.
target: Even my tears burn me like molten lead.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, Gloucester, Gloucester, I’d speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.
target: Gloucester, Gloucester, I want to speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.

orig: translate old to modern: Say, how is that?
target: How do you mean?

orig: translate old to modern: And a good soldier too, lady.
target: He’s a good soldier too, lady.

orig: translate old to modern: She will not.
target: She will not.

orig: translate old to modern: Fie upon't!
target: Shame on it!

orig: translate old to modern: Where is he?
target: Where is he?

orig: translate old to modern: Now follows, that you know, young Fortinbras, Holding a weak supposal of our worth, Or thinking by our late dear brother's death Our state to be disjoint and out of frame, Colleagued with this dream of his advantage, He hath not fail'd to pester us with message, Importing the surrender of those lands Lost by his father, with all bonds of law, To our most valiant brother.
target: I will tell you now, as you know, young Fortinbras, Not thinking very much of us, Or thinking that our late dear brother's death Made our country disorganized and no longer powerful, Conspiring with this dream of his advantage, Has not failed to pester us with messages, Asking us to the surrender of those lands Lost by his father, within all the rules of law, To our most valiant brother.

orig: translate old to modern: I was enforc'd to send it after him; I was beset with shame and courtesy; My honour would not let ingratitude So much besmear it.
target: I forced to send the ring after him; I was overcome with shame and courtesy; My honor would not let ingratitude So much offend it.

orig: translate old to modern: If we are marked to die, we are enough To do our country loss; and if to live, The fewer men, the greater share of honor.
target: If we are slated to die, the fewer, the better for our country, and if we’re slated to live, the fewer men, the greater the share of honor for each of us.

orig: translate old to modern: Not that I know.
target: Not that I know of.

orig: translate old to modern: why, revenge.
target: Why, revenge.

orig: translate old to modern: Out on thee, seeming!
target: Curse you for your false appearances!

orig: translate old to modern: But are not some whole that we must make sick?
target: But aren’t some well that we must make sick?

orig: translate old to modern: No.
target: No.

orig: translate old to modern: Give ’s your hand.
target: Let’s shake on it.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, sir, I trust I may have leave to speak, And speak I will.
target: Sir, I think I have the right to speak, and speak I certainly will.

orig: translate old to modern: It is not words that shakes me thus.
target: It is not words that shake me like this.

orig: translate old to modern: What, you mean my face?
target: What, you mean my face looks like a crab-apple?

orig: translate old to modern: Pray you, tell him I am his fortune’s vassal, and I send him The greatness he has got.
target: Please tell him I have surrendered to his fortune.

orig: translate old to modern: Surely, a princely testimony, a goodly count, Count Comfect, a sweet gallant, surely!
target: He’s a proper count, that Count Sugarplum, a sweet gentleman, for sure!

orig: translate old to modern: My worthy Cawdor!
target: My worthy Cawdor!

orig: translate old to modern: Thou shalt have nothing but the forfeiture, To be so taken at thy peril, Jew.
target: You shall have nothing but the penalty To be so taken at your own risk, Jew.

orig: translate old to modern: Here’s a good world the while.
target: What a backward world we live in!

orig: translate old to modern: Yea, just so much as you may take upon a knife’s point and choke a daw withal.
target: Yes, as much pleasure as one might take in choking a bird at knifepoint.

orig: translate old to modern: The Lord in heaven bless thee, noble Harry!
target: The Lord in heaven bless you, noble Harry!

orig: translate old to modern: Myself myself confound, Heaven and fortune bar me happy hours, Day, yield me not thy light, nor night thy rest, Be opposite all planets of good luck To my proceedings if, with dear heart’s love, Immaculate devotion, holy thoughts, I tender not thy beauteous princely daughter.
target: Let me destroy myself, let heaven and destiny deprive me of happy hours, let day remain dark and night sleepless, and let me have nothing but terrible luck if I do not love with a pure heart, clean devotion, and holy thoughts your beautiful royal daughter.

orig: translate old to modern: let the door be lock'd.
target: Let the doors be locked.

orig: translate old to modern: Let us deal justly.
target: Let’s give a fair verdict.

orig: translate old to modern: Here in this island we arrived, and here Have I, thy schoolmaster, made thee more profit Than other princesess’ can, that have more time For vainer hours and tutors not so careful.
target: We arrived here on this island: and here I, your schoolmaster, have made you grow more Than other princes can, who have more time For worthless hours, and tutors that are not as careful.

orig: translate old to modern: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother!
target: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother!

orig: translate old to modern: No marvel, lord, though it affrighted you.
target: Clarence has arrived—lying, cowardly  I’m not surprised it scared you, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Shall I know your answer?
target: Can I know your answer?

orig: translate old to modern: Well, I am not fair, and therefore I pray the gods make me honest.
target: Well, I’m not beautiful, so I hope that I can at least be chaste.

orig: translate old to modern: I have used it, nuncle, ever since thou madest thy daughters thy mothers.
target: I’ve been singing ever since you made your daughters into your mothers by giving them all your power.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll see it done.
target: I'll see it is done.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell me your mind.
target: Tell me what you want.

orig: translate old to modern: Tropically.
target: A metaphor.

orig: translate old to modern: Go to your rest; at night we'll feast together.
target: Get some rest, tonight we'll feast together.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll write straight to my sister To hold my very course.
target: I’ll write to my sister and tell her my plans.

orig: translate old to modern: Is't possible?
target: Is it possible?

orig: translate old to modern: Nor, I am sure, there is no force in eyes That can do hurt.
target: Now I am sure that eyes can’t hurt a person.

orig: translate old to modern: As young as I am, I have observed these three swashers.
target: Young though I am, I’ve been observing these three blowhards closely.

orig: translate old to modern: If she convey Letters to Richmond, you shall answer it.
target: If she sends any letters to Richmond, you will be accountable to me for it.

orig: translate old to modern: How now!
target: How now!

orig: translate old to modern: O these deliberate fools!
target: Oh, these deliberate fools!

orig: translate old to modern: I found him here as melancholy as a lodge in a warren.
target: I found him here,  Beating?

orig: translate old to modern: You can fool no more money out of me at this throw.
target: You can’t get any more money out of me right now.

orig: translate old to modern: now to my mother!
target: now to my mother.

orig: translate old to modern: Our intent Was to be gone from Athens, where we might, Without the peril of the Athenian law.
target: Our intention Was to be gone from Athens, and to get to a place Where we might be together without the Punishment of the Athenian law.

orig: translate old to modern: She knows the heat of a luxurious bed.
target: She has been in a man’s bed.

orig: translate old to modern: I am ashamed that women are so simple To offer war where they should kneel for peace; Or seek for rule, supremacy and sway When they are bound to serve, love, and obey.
target: I am ashamed that women are so foolish as to declare war when they should plead on their knees for peace, that they seek authority, supremacy, and power when they are under an obligation to serve, love, and obey.

orig: translate old to modern: Masters, never speak, we charge you, let us obey you go with us.
target: We’re probably a very valuable catch for these guys.

orig: translate old to modern: Confess, and love, Had been the very sum of my confession: O happy torment, when my torturer Doth teach me answers for deliverance!
target: Confess” and “love” Have been the very sum of my confession: Oh, happy torment, when my torturer Teaches me answers for escape from evil!

orig: translate old to modern: I cannot tell.
target: It’s not for me to say.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet here, Laertes?
target: You’re still here, Laertes!

orig: translate old to modern: Well, I am standing water.
target: Well, I am standing water.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor I in yours Till I again see mine.
target: And neither will I Until I see mine again.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, swear it, damn thyself; Lest, being like one of heaven, the devils themselves Should fear to seize thee.
target: Come, swear it, damn yourself; Lest, being like one of heaven, the devils themselves Should fear to seize you.

orig: translate old to modern: But that my Lady Beatrice should know me, and not know me!
target: But how strange that Beatrice should seem to know who I was and yet not know at the same time.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, that's my dainty Ariel!
target: Why, that's my delicate Ariel!

orig: translate old to modern: So you walk softly, and look sweetly, and say nothing, I am yours for the walk, and especially when I walk away.
target: As long as you move gracefully, look handsome, and say nothing, I’m yours for the dance.

orig: translate old to modern: Iago!
target: Iago?

orig: translate old to modern: Edmund I think is gone In pity of his misery to dispatch His nighted life; moreover to descry The strength o' th' enemy.
target: And also to find out the size of the enemy army.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me my principal, and let me go.
target: Give me my principal, and let me go.

orig: translate old to modern: By my faith, he is very swift and sententious.
target: Really, he’s very witty, and full of wise sayings.

orig: translate old to modern: Who's there?
target: Who's there?

orig: translate old to modern: Looks it not like the King?
target: Doesn’t it look like the King?

orig: translate old to modern: Now to you.
target: Now this is where you come in.

orig: translate old to modern: How does he love me?
target: How does he love me?

orig: translate old to modern: Welcome.
target: Welcome.

orig: translate old to modern: And so I am, I am.
target: And I am, I am.

orig: translate old to modern: If we do lose this battle, then is this The very last time we shall speak together.
target: If we lose this battle, then this is The very last time we shall speak together.

orig: translate old to modern: I fear ’tis choleric.
target: I’m afraid it will make you too hot, too.

orig: translate old to modern: Your children were vexation to your youth, But mine shall be a comfort to your age.
target: Your children caused you trouble in your youth, but mine will bring you comfort in your old age.

orig: translate old to modern: Fulvia thy wife first came into the field.
target: Your wife, Fulvia, mustered her army first.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou shalt know the man By the Athenian garments he hath on.
target: You’ll be able to identify the man By the Athenian garments he has on.

orig: translate old to modern: For your desire to know what is between us O'ermaster't as you may.
target: As for your desire to know what happened between us, Control it the best you can.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell the constable.
target: Tell the constable that.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou hadst need send for more money.
target: Tomorrow you need to get more money sent to you.

orig: translate old to modern: For the which I hear what they say of him.
target: I hear what they say about him for doing that.

orig: translate old to modern: Fear nothing.
target: Don’t be afraid.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, faith, let not me play a woman; I have a beard coming.
target: No, please, don’t let me play a woman; I have a beard starting t o grow.

orig: translate old to modern: So doth the woodbine the sweet honeysuckle Gently entwist; the female ivy so Enrings the barky fingers of the elm.
target: I will put my arms around you just as the woodbine twists around the sweet honeysuckle,— like the female ivy Winds around the branches of the elm.

orig: translate old to modern: There’s hell, there’s darkness, there’s the sulfurous pit— burning, scalding, stench, consumption!
target: That’s where hell is, and darkness, and fires and stench!

orig: translate old to modern: Not so young, sir, to love a woman for singing, nor so old to dote on her for anything.
target: Not young enough to fall in love with a woman because she sings well, but not old enough to dote on a woman for any reason.

orig: translate old to modern: These are old fond paradoxes to make fools laugh i' the alehouse.
target: These are old wives’ tales to make fools laugh in the alehouse.

orig: translate old to modern: I see a voice; now will I to the chink, To spy an I can hear my Thisbe's face.
target: I see a voice; now I’ll go to the chink, To spy if I can hear my Thisbe's face.

orig: translate old to modern: Caesar is sad, and Lepidus, Since Pompey’s feast, as Menas says, is troubled With the greensickness.
target: Caesar is in a sober mood.

orig: translate old to modern: Those that are married already—all but one—shall live; the rest shall keep as they are.
target: those that are married already, all but one, shall live, the rest stay the same.

orig: translate old to modern: It pleases your Worship to say so, but we are the poor duke’s officers.
target: Thank you for saying that, your Worship, but we’re just the poor duke’s officers.

orig: translate old to modern: Never make known what you have seen to-night.
target: Never make known what you have seen tonight.

orig: translate old to modern: Run after that same peevish messenger, The county’s man.
target: Run after that obnoxious messenger, the duke’s servant.

orig: translate old to modern: Men shall deal unadvisedly sometimes, Which after-hours give leisure to repent.
target: Men act imprudently sometimes, then realize their mistakes when they have time to think about them.

orig: translate old to modern: For certes these are people of the island, Who, though they are of monstrous shape, yet note, Their manners are more gentle-kind than of Our human generation you shall find Many, nay, almost any.
target: If I should say, I saw similar islanders,— Because, truly, these are people of the island,— Who, though, they are of monstrous shape, yet, notice that Their manners are more gentle than those of Our human generation that you shall find Many, no, almost any.

orig: translate old to modern: I am quickly ill, and well, So Antony loves.
target: Just as Antony loves.

orig: translate old to modern: I would not be the villain that thou think'st For the whole space that's in the tyrant's grasp And the rich East to boot.
target: I do not wish to be the villain that you may think, For the whole space that's in the tyrant's grasp And the rich East to boot.

orig: translate old to modern: Caesar, and that, having in Sicily Sextus Pompeius spoiled, we had not rated him His part o’ th’ isle.
target: He accuses me of withholding his share of Sextus Pompeius’ possessions, which we seized in Sicily.

orig: translate old to modern: So could I too.
target: So could I.

orig: translate old to modern: How oddly he is suited!
target: How oddly he is dressed!

orig: translate old to modern: My learnèd lord, we pray you to proceed And justly and religiously unfold Why the law Salic that they have in France Or should or should not bar us in our claim.
target: My learned lord, kindly explain to us the legal and religious grounds for why this French Salic law either should or shouldn’t bar me in my claim.

orig: translate old to modern: Dolabella!
target: Dolabella.

orig: translate old to modern: Come hither, gentlemen, And lay your hands again upon my sword.
target: Come over here, gentlemen, And lay your hands again on my sword.

orig: translate old to modern: We love him highly, And shall continue our graces towards him.
target: We love him highly, And shall continue our graces towards him.

orig: translate old to modern: She had a song of “willow”; An old thing 'twas, but it express'd her fortune, And she died singing it.
target: She had a song of "willow," It was an old thing but it expressed her fortune, And she died singing it.

orig: translate old to modern: Farewell, father.
target: Farewell, father.

orig: translate old to modern: The King, the King's to blame.
target: The King, the King's to blame.

orig: translate old to modern: Now, my friendly knave, I thank thee.
target: Now, my friendly servant, thank you.

orig: translate old to modern: Hold you, there is a groat to heal your pate.
target: Wait, here’s a penny to heal your head.

orig: translate old to modern: Observe her; stand close.
target: Observe her; stand close.

orig: translate old to modern: It must be your imagination then, and not theirs.
target: It must be your imagination then, and not theirs.

orig: translate old to modern: How dangerous is it that this man goes loose!
target: How dangerous is it that this man goes loose!

orig: translate old to modern: Thou pray'st not well.
target: You don’t pray well.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis fittest.
target: That’s most appropriate.

orig: translate old to modern: aside] They vanished strangely.
target: They vanished strangely.

orig: translate old to modern: They told me I was everything.
target: They told me I was everything.

orig: translate old to modern: We have consented to all terms of reason.
target: We have consented to all reasonable terms.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis pity of him.
target: It’s too bad.

orig: translate old to modern: She were an excellent wife for Benedict.
target: She would make a good wife for Benedick.

orig: translate old to modern: He supp'd at my house; but I therefore shake not.
target: He dined at my house; but I don’t shake because of that.

orig: translate old to modern: How like a fawning publican he looks!
target: He looks like a flattering tax collector!

orig: translate old to modern: You knew my father well, and in him me, Left solely heir to all his lands and goods, Which I have bettered rather than decreased.
target: You knew my father well; therefore, you know me, the sole heir to all his property and possessions, which I have added to rather than depleted.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me thy arm.
target: Give me your arm.

orig: translate old to modern: You shall have the mustard Or else you get no beef of Grumio.
target: You’ll take the mustard or you’ll get no beef from Grumio.

orig: translate old to modern: Go to thy cold bed and warm thee.
target: Get into your cold beds and warm yourselves up.

orig: translate old to modern: If haply you my father do suspect An instrument of this your calling back, Lay not your blame on me.
target: If you maybe suspect my father is An instrument of this calling you back, Don’t lay your blame on me.

orig: translate old to modern: You are a fool.—You, niece, provide yourself.
target: You are a fool.—You, niece, prepare to leave.

orig: translate old to modern: But I have spoke With one that saw him die, who did report That very frankly he confess'd his treasons, Implored your highness’ pardon, and set forth A deep repentance.
target: Only I have spoke With someone who saw him die, and he reported That he confessed his treasons very frankly; He begged your highness for pardon; and he seemed Very sorry.

orig: translate old to modern: O murderous coxcomb!
target: O murderous simpleton!

orig: translate old to modern: Good madam, let me see your face.
target: Madam, please let me see your face.

orig: translate old to modern: Out, damned spot!
target: Out, damned spot!

orig: translate old to modern: There were none principal.
target: There were no primary ones.

orig: translate old to modern: The ingratitude of this Seleucus does Even make me wild.
target: Seleucus’ ingratitude makes me wild.

orig: translate old to modern: to Ferdinand] If I have too austerely punished you, [to Ferdinand] If I have too Your compensation makes amends, for I Have given you here a third of mine own life— Or that for which I live—who once again I tender to thy hand.
target: If I have punished you too harshly, Your payment makes up for it, because I Have given you here a third of my own life, Or the part for which I live, who, once again, I give to you.

orig: translate old to modern: Fair sir, you are well o'erta'en: My Lord Bassanio, upon more advice, Hath sent you here this ring, and doth entreat Your company at dinner.
target: My Lord Bassanio, listening to more advice, Has sent you this ring here, and asks Your company at dinner.

orig: translate old to modern: I marry her!
target: Me marry her!

orig: translate old to modern: I will have nothing else but only this; And now, methinks, I have a mind to it.
target: I’ll have nothing else except this only; And now, I think, I have a mind to have it.

orig: translate old to modern: In practice let us put it presently.
target: Let’s get started right away.

orig: translate old to modern: You know he does.
target: You know that he does.

orig: translate old to modern: O heaven defend me!
target: O heaven defend me!

orig: translate old to modern: You have often Begun to tell me what I am, but stopped And left me to a bootless inquisition, Concluding ‘Stay, not yet.’ The hour's now come; The very minute bids thee ope thine ear, Obey, and be attentive.
target: You have often Started to tell me who I am, but you stopped, And left me to a useless questioning, Concluding “Wait, not yet.” Now it’s time, The very minute asks you to listen carefully; Obey and listen.

orig: translate old to modern: But virtue, as it never will be moved, Though lewdness court it in a shape of heaven, So lust, though to a radiant angel link'd, Will sate itself in a celestial bed And prey on garbage.
target: But as virtue can never be moved, it Was courted though lewdness in a shape of heaven, And lust, though linked to a radiant angel, Will satisfy itself in a heavenly bed And eat garbage.

orig: translate old to modern: Ah, Tranio, what a cruel father’s he!
target: Oh, Tranio, what a cruel father he is.

orig: translate old to modern: No?
target: No?

orig: translate old to modern: Tell thou the tale!
target: It’s too bad.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, my lord.
target: Yes, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: The violence of either grief or joy Their own enactures with themselves destroy.
target: The violence of either grief or joy Destroys their own keeping of them with themselves.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll confine myself no finer than I am.
target: Keep myself?

orig: translate old to modern: You do me wrong to take me out o' th' grave.
target: You do me wrong by taking me out of the grave.

orig: translate old to modern: As Caesar loved me, I weep for him; as he was fortunate, I rejoice at it; as he was valiant, I honor him; but as he was ambitious, I slew him.
target: As Caesar loved me, I weep for him; as he was fortunate, I rejoice at it; as he was valiant, I honor him; but, as he was ambitious, I killed him.

orig: translate old to modern: Let us be conjunctive in our revenge against him.
target: Let us be united in our revenge against him.

orig: translate old to modern: I shall laugh myself to death at this puppy-headed monster.
target: I shall laugh myself to death at this puppy-headed monster.

orig: translate old to modern: Knock, sir?
target: Knock, sir?

orig: translate old to modern: Who goes there, ha?
target: Who are these people?

orig: translate old to modern: Till night, my lord, and all night too.
target: No, the whole day, and all night too.

orig: translate old to modern: Have I the aspic in my lips?
target: Do I have the asp’s poison on my lips?

orig: translate old to modern: He’ll speak with you, will you or no.
target: He insists he’ll speak with you whether you want him to or not.

orig: translate old to modern: No, not much moved.
target: No, not too upset.

orig: translate old to modern: Well then, if ever I thank any man, I’ll thank you.
target: Well then, if I’ve ever thanked a man, I’ll thank you now.

orig: translate old to modern: The gods make this a happy day to Antony!
target: May the gods bless Antony today!

orig: translate old to modern: They are winged.
target: They have wings.

orig: translate old to modern: What’s to say?
target: What’s there to say?

orig: translate old to modern: Well, gaoler, on:—Pray God, Bassanio come To see me pay his debt, and then I care not!
target: Well, jailer, let’s go on; I pray good Bassanio comes To see me pay his debt, and then I won’t care.

orig: translate old to modern: Where is my father?
target: Where is my father?

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, grieve not you; you are welcome notwithstanding.
target: Sir, don’t grieve; you are welcome nevertheless.

orig: translate old to modern: Your lord does know my mind.
target: Your lord knows what I think.

orig: translate old to modern: Moon and stars!
target: By the moon and stars!

orig: translate old to modern: Twas you we laughed at.
target: It was you we laughed at.

orig: translate old to modern: Wouldst thou give 'em all?
target: Did you have to give them everything?

orig: translate old to modern: How can that be?
target: How can that be?

orig: translate old to modern: O devil, devil!
target: O devil, devil!

orig: translate old to modern: Let me tell you, Cassius, you yourself Are much condemn'd to have an itching palm, To sell and mart your offices for gold To undeservers.
target: Let me tell you, Cassius, you yourself Are much condemned for being greedy, To sell and advertise your offices To unworthy people for gold.

orig: translate old to modern: Your Majesty shall mock at me.
target: Your Majesty shall mock at me.

orig: translate old to modern: I hear a tongue, shriller than all the music, Cry “Caesar.” Speak, Caesar is turn'd to hear.
target: I hear a voice that is more shrill than all the music Yelling, "Caesar"!

orig: translate old to modern: How answer you that?
target: What do you think about that?

orig: translate old to modern: You may be rightly just, Whatever I shall think.
target: You may be rightly just, Whatever I shall think.

orig: translate old to modern: He fell down in the market-place and foamed at mouth and was speechless.
target: He fell down in the market place, foamed at the mouth, and was speechless.

orig: translate old to modern: Then pardon him, sweet father, for my sake.
target: So pardon him, dear father, for my sake.

orig: translate old to modern: He is too disputable for my company.
target: He’s too argumentative for me.

orig: translate old to modern: When Marcus Brutus grows so covetous To lock such rascal counters from his friends, Be ready, gods, with all your thunderbolts, Dash him to pieces!
target: When Marcus Brutus grows so greedy as To engage his friend in such battles, Be ready, gods, with all your thunderbolts, Cut him into pieces!

orig: translate old to modern: O this learning, what a thing it is!
target: Oh, what an excellent thing this learning is!

orig: translate old to modern: Let me sit down.
target: Let me sit down.

orig: translate old to modern: Hurt him in eleven places.
target: Hurt him in eleven different places.

orig: translate old to modern: Take him hence.
target: Take him away.

orig: translate old to modern: Adieu.
target: Adieu.

orig: translate old to modern: Now Margaret’s curse is fall'n upon our heads, When she exclaimed on Hastings, you, and I, For standing by when Richard stabbed her son.
target: Now Margaret’s curse has fallen on our heads, for standing by and doing nothing when Richard stabbed her son.

orig: translate old to modern: I do assure thee, father, so it is.
target: I assure you, sir, it’s true.

orig: translate old to modern: Withdraw; I hear him coming.
target: Hide, I hear him coming.

orig: translate old to modern: I do not well know, my lord.
target: I’m not sure, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: As I told thee before, I am subject to a tyrant, a sorcerer, that by his cunning hath cheated me of the island.
target: As I told you before, I am subject to a tyrant, sorcerer, that has cheated me of the island by his cunning.

orig: translate old to modern: Look where the youngest wren of nine comes.
target: Here comes my little bird.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me your arm.
target: Give me your arm.

orig: translate old to modern: Who can control his fate?
target: Who can control his fate?

orig: translate old to modern: I'll to my book, For yet ere supper-time must I perform Much business appertaining.
target: I'll go to my book; Because still, before supper time, I must complete A lot of business relating to these two.

orig: translate old to modern: Good fool, for my brother’s death.
target: My dear fool, because my brother died.

orig: translate old to modern: I have spoke thus much, To mitigate the justice of thy plea, Which if thou follow, this strict court of Venice Must needs give sentence 'gainst the merchant there.
target: I have spoken this much To soften the justice of your plea, Which if you follow, this strict court of Venice Must give a ruling against the merchant there.

orig: translate old to modern: Marry, beshrew my hand If it should give your age such cause of fear.
target: Curse my hand if it ever threatened an old man like you.

orig: translate old to modern: O Caesar, read mine first, for mine's a suit That touches Caesar nearer.
target: O Caesar, read mine first, because mine's a suit That touches Caesar nearer.

orig: translate old to modern: Many will swoon when they do look on blood.
target: Many people faint when they see blood.

orig: translate old to modern: God speak this “amen”!
target: God say, “Amen”!

orig: translate old to modern: But what praise couldst thou bestow on a deserving woman indeed, one that in the authority of her merit did justly put on the vouch of very malice itself?
target: But what praise could you bestow on a deserving woman indeed, one that, in the authority of her merit, rightly wore the witnessing of very malice itself?

orig: translate old to modern: Rest you happy!
target: Have a good night!

orig: translate old to modern: What should I think on ’t?
target: What’s the obvious conclusion from that?

orig: translate old to modern: My sister may receive it much more worse To have her gentleman abused, assaulted For following her affairs.—Put in his legs.
target: My sister would be much more offended to have her trusted messenger abused and assaulted just for carrying out her orders.—Put his legs in the stocks.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis a strange serpent.
target: It’s a strange snake.

orig: translate old to modern: Very well.
target: Very well.

orig: translate old to modern: Hush!
target: Quiet!

orig: translate old to modern: Speak to me.
target: You can speak to me.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, in Athens.
target: He’s in Athens, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Hear me yet, good Shylock.
target: But, listen to me, good Shylock.

orig: translate old to modern: Was ever woman in this humor wooed?
target: Has anyone ever courted a woman in this state of mind?

orig: translate old to modern: Have you heard of no likely wars toward ’twixt the two Dukes of Cornwall and Albany?
target: You haven’t heard of the war brewing between the Dukes of Cornwall and Albany?

orig: translate old to modern: But what’s the matter, Clarence?
target: But, really, what’s going on, Clarence?

orig: translate old to modern: Shall I strike at it with my partisan?
target: Shall I strike at it with my club?

orig: translate old to modern: Away!
target: away!

orig: translate old to modern: Why the King of France is so suddenly gone back know you the reason?
target: Do you know why the King of France suddenly went back home?

orig: translate old to modern: Here’s no knavery!
target: I’ll disguise myself in somber robes.

orig: translate old to modern: But what’s your will?
target: But what did you want?

orig: translate old to modern: Now, in faith, Gratiano, You give your wife too unkind a cause of grief; An 'twere to me, I should be mad at it.
target: Now, truly, Gratiano, You give your wife a cause for grief that is very unkind; If it was given to me, I should be angry about it.

orig: translate old to modern: If he, compact of jars, grow musical, We shall have shortly discord in the spheres.
target: If that man, who’s made up of conflicts, becomes musical, then there must be something wrong with the universe.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, thou loss upon loss!
target: Why, you—loss on loss!

orig: translate old to modern: Where should they be set else?
target: Where else should they be set?

orig: translate old to modern: Take no offense that I would not offend you.
target: Please don’t be offended that I don’t want to offend you any more.

orig: translate old to modern: Caesar should be a beast without a heart If he should stay at home today for fear.
target: Caesar should be a beast without a heart, If he stays at home today because he’s afraid.

orig: translate old to modern: I know he would not be a wolf But that he sees the Romans are but sheep.
target: I know he wouldn’t be a wolf, But he sees that the Romans are nothing but sheep.

orig: translate old to modern: This is a practise As full of labor as a wise man’s art, For folly that he wisely shows is fit.
target: And he doesn’t let go of his target when a distraction appears.

orig: translate old to modern: You shall see it will fall pat as I told you; yonder she comes.
target: You shall see it will fall right just as I told you.—she comes From over there.

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, by your patience: if I heard you rightly, The duke hath put on a religious life And thrown into neglect the pompous court.
target: Do you mean to say that the duke has abandoned the glamorous court to live as a monk?

orig: translate old to modern: Know, Claudio, to thy head, Thou hast so wronged mine innocent child and me That I am forced to lay my reverence by, And with gray hairs and bruise of many days Do challenge thee to trial of a man.
target: Claudio, I’m telling you right to your face that you have wronged me and my innocent child.

orig: translate old to modern: Well said.
target: That’s well spoken.

orig: translate old to modern: How is't with you?
target: How is it with you?

orig: translate old to modern: I have't.
target: I have it!

orig: translate old to modern: How vexest thou this man!
target: Why are you bothering this poor man!

orig: translate old to modern: Pray you Be ever known to patience.
target: I beg you to continue to be patient.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou seest we are not all alone unhappy.
target: You see, we’re not alone in our unhappiness.

orig: translate old to modern: Haste thee for thy life.
target: Run as if your life depended on it.

orig: translate old to modern: On him, on him!
target: On him, on him!

orig: translate old to modern: I will not trust you, I; Nor longer stay in your curst company.
target: I will not trust you, I won’t; And I’ll stay in your cursed company no longer.

orig: translate old to modern: But I’ll not chide thee.
target: But I’ll stop rebuking you.

orig: translate old to modern: The sooner, sweet, for you.
target: The sooner, sweet, for you.

orig: translate old to modern: Sir, in fine, Seeing how loathly opposite I stood To his unnatural purpose, in fell motion, With his preparèd sword he charges home My unprovided body, latched mine arm.
target: In short, when I told him how firmly opposed I was to his hideous plan, he pulled out his sword and lunged at my defenseless body, cutting my arm.

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll make one too.
target: I’ll come too.

orig: translate old to modern: Aside] It goes on, I see, [Aside] As my soul prompts it.
target: Aside] It goes just the way, I see, That my soul wants it.—Spirit, fine spirit!

target: This feather moved because of her breath.

orig: translate old to modern: Rebellion's head, rise never, till the Wood Of Birnam rise, and our high-placed Macbeth Shall live the lease of nature, pay his breath To time and mortal custom.
target: Rebellion's head will never rise until the wood Of Birnam rise, and our high-placed Macbeth Shall live until his dying day, the death of His own time and mortal custom.

target: You expect me to cry?

target: Look, where he goes, even now out the door!

target: Phoebe, keep your promise to marry me, and to marry this shepherd if you choose to refuse me.

target: A sealed bag, two sealed bags of dollars, Of double dollars, stolen from me by my daughter!

target: I will, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: But that I am forbid To tell the secrets of my prison-house, I could a tale unfold whose lightest word Would harrow up thy soul, freeze thy young blood, Make thy two eyes, like stars, start from their spheres, Thy knotted and combined locks to part, And each particular hair to stand an end Like quills upon the fretful porpentine.
target: If I were not forbidden To tell the secrets of my prison house, I could tell a tale whose lightest word Would crush your soul, freeze your young blood, Make your two eyes, like stars, jump from their sockets, Your knotted and combined hair to separate, And each particular hair to stand on end Like quills on the angry porcupine.

target: So the candle went out and now we’re all in the dark.

target: Hurry up.

orig: translate old to modern: Hastings and Edward’s children, Grey and Rivers, Holy King Henry and thy fair son Edward, Vaughan, and all that have miscarrièd By underhand, corrupted, foul injustice, If that your moody, discontented souls Do through the clouds behold this present hour, Even for revenge mock my destruction.— This is All Souls' Day, fellow, is it not?
target: Hastings and Edward’s children, Rivers and Grey, holy King Henry and your fine son Edward, Vaughan, and all who have died from underhanded, corrupt, fiendish injustice, if your angry souls are witnessing this moment through the clouds, enjoy the revenge—laugh at my ruin!

target: Let’s go.

target: I might as well go before the King of France, who took my youngest daughter without a dowry, kneel before his throne, and beg him to give me a tiny pension to stay alive.

orig: translate old to modern: It is the right butter-women’s rank to market.

target: Tie him up harder.—You filthy traitor!

target: But I can’t be too obvious about being on your side without risking the life of your stepbrother, young George.

target: That is Laertes, A very noble youth.

target: Revenge it like a man.

orig: translate old to modern: And therefore, since I cannot prove a lover To entertain these fair well-spoken days, I am determinèd to prove a villain And hate the idle pleasures of these days.
target: Since I can’t amuse myself by being a lover, I’ve decided to become a villain.

target: I will stay covered here until the last of the storm is over.

target: This isn’t Brutus, friend, but, I assure you, A prize no less worthy.

orig: translate old to modern: You would be, sweet madam, if your miseries were in the same abundance as your good fortunes are; and yet, for aught I see, they are as sick that surfeit with too much, as they that starve with nothing.
target: You would be, sweet madam, if your miseries were as abundant as your good fortunes are; and yet, for all I see, they that are sick from over-eating are as sick as those that starve with nothing.

orig: translate old to modern: I will be hang'd, if some eternal villain, Some busy and insinuating rogue, Some cogging cozening slave, to get some office, Have not devised this slander; I'll be hang'd else.
target: I will be hanged, if some eternal villain, Some busy and insinuating rogue, Some scheming, lying slave, to get some job, Hasn’t made up this slander, or else, I'll be hanged.

target: Heaven thumbs its nose at it, and the moon winks; The obscene wind that kisses all it meets Is quiet within the hollow tunnels of earth, And will not hear it.

target: Every second you delay is as long and dull as a journey to South Seas.

target: I know a lady in Venice would have walked barefoot to Palestine for a touch of his lower lip.

target: Once I’ve put my rackets to these balls, I’ll play a set in France, God willing, that will knock his father’s crown right out of the court.

orig: translate old to modern: These fifteen years!
target: Fifteen years!

target: The moon, I think, looks as if she has watery eyes, And when she weeps, every little flower weeps, Lamenting some enforced chastity.

target: Even if I went to church And saw the holy building of stone, I’d be thinking right away about dangerous rocks, Which, touching only my gentle vessel's side, Would scatter all her spices across the water, Spreading my silk cargo across the roaring waters, And, in a word, one minute worth this amount of money, And now worth nothing.
