target: No, Caesar doesn’t have it; but you, and I, And honest Casca, we have epilepsy.

orig: translate old to modern: How was this seal'd?
target: How was this sealed?

orig: translate old to modern: Let but the commons hear this testament— Which, pardon me, I do not mean to read— And they would go and kiss dead Caesar's wounds And dip their napkins in his sacred blood, Yea, beg a hair of him for memory, And, dying, mention it within their wills, Bequeathing it as a rich legacy Unto their issue.
target: Let only the common people hear this testament,— Which, pardon me, I don’t mean to read,— And they would go and kiss dead Caesar's wounds, And dip their napkins in his sacred blood; Yes, beg a hair of him for memory, And, dying, mention that hair in their wills, Leaving it as a rich legacy To their children.

orig: translate old to modern: Good morrow, masters.
target: Good morning, gentlemen.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll put another question to thee.
target: I’ll put another question to you.

orig: translate old to modern: Ish a villain and a basterd and a knave and a rascal.
target: It’s a villain and a bastard and a coward and a rascal.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll show thee the best springs; I'll pluck thee berries; I'll fish for thee, and get thee wood enough.
target: I'll show you the best springs; I'll pluck you berries; I'll fish for you, and get you enough wood.

orig: translate old to modern: My liberty.
target: My freedom.

orig: translate old to modern: Because that, like a jack, thou keep’st the stroke Betwixt thy begging and my meditation.
target: Because you’re like the lowborn fellow who strikes the bell—you keep interrupting my thoughts.

orig: translate old to modern: O, you and I have heard our fathers say There was a Brutus once that would have brook'd The eternal devil to keep his state in Rome As easily as a king.
target: O, you and I have heard our fathers say There was a Brutus once that would have fought The eternal devil to keep his status in Rome, As easily as he would fight a king!

orig: translate old to modern: What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
target: What wound ever healed except bit by bit?

orig: translate old to modern: You should not have believed me; for virtue cannot so inoculate our old stock but we shall relish of it.
target: You should not have believed me, for virtue can’t graft a new plant onto our old stock but we shall relish of it.

orig: translate old to modern: I will, sir.
target: I will, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: There’s strange news come, sir.
target: Some startling news has just arrived, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, but the devil take mocking.
target: Damn you for mocking me.

orig: translate old to modern: What mean'st thou by that?
target: What do you mean by that?

orig: translate old to modern: Who's there?
target: Who's there?

orig: translate old to modern: I am sure of that.
target: I’m sure of that.

orig: translate old to modern: Methought I was, and methought I had, but man is but a patched fool, if he will offer to say what methought I had.
target: I thought I was, and I thought I had,—but a man is only a mended fool, if he will offer to say what I thought I had.

orig: translate old to modern: I make not, but foresee.
target: I don’t make fortunes; I only see them.

orig: translate old to modern: Harry le Roy.
target: Harry le Roy.

orig: translate old to modern: But, sure, the bravery of his grief did put me Into a towering passion.
target: But, for sure, the bravery of his grief put me Into a towering passion.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis certain there’s not a boy left alive, and the cowardly rascals that ran from the battle ha' done this slaughter.
target: There’s certainly not a boy left alive, and it was done by the cowardly rascals who were running from the battle.

orig: translate old to modern: And then, as we have ta'en the sacrament, We will unite the white rose and the red.
target: As I vowed, I will unite the York and Lancaster families.

orig: translate old to modern: Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.
target: Nonsense, nonsense, it will not appear.

orig: translate old to modern: Nine or ten times I had thought to have yerk'd him here under the ribs.
target: Nine or ten times I had thought to have stabbed him here under the ribs.

orig: translate old to modern: Ah, ha, my lord, this prince is not an Edward!
target: Ah, my lord, this prince is nothing like Edward!

orig: translate old to modern: By Jupiter, I swear “No.” By Juno, I swear “Ay.”    They durst not do ’t.
target: By the god Jupiter above, I swear “No.” By Jupiter’s wife Juno, I swear “Yes.” They wouldn’t dare.

orig: translate old to modern: Your Highness bade me ask for it today.
target: Your Highness told me to ask for my commission today.

orig: translate old to modern: O, treachery!
target: O, treachery!

orig: translate old to modern: But jealous souls will not be answer'd so; They are not ever jealous for the cause, But jealous for they are jealous.
target: But jealous souls will not be answered that way; They are not ever jealous for a reason, But jealous because they are jealous.

orig: translate old to modern: Is this the Prince’s brother?
target: Is this the Prince’s brother?

orig: translate old to modern: The worser welcome.
target: The worst welcome.

orig: translate old to modern: I do attend here on the general; And think it no addition, nor my wish, To have him see me woman'd.
target: I’m waiting here for the general, And I don’t think it would help, and it’s not my wish, To have him see me talking with a woman.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll charm the air to give a sound, While you perform your antic round, That this great King may kindly say Our duties did his welcome pay.
target: I'll charm the air to give a sound, While you perform your antic round; That this great king may kindly say, Our duties did his welcome pay.

orig: translate old to modern: Is not marriage honorable in a beggar?
target: Sex and marriage are honorable things—even for a beggar, right?

orig: translate old to modern: Stay yet.
target: Hang on a second.

target: My lord, I don’t know that I did cry.

orig: translate old to modern: But upon the fairest boughs, Or at every sentence end, Will I “Rosalinda” write, Teaching all that read to know The quintessence of every sprite Heaven would in little show.
target: But on the prettiest branches Or at the end of every sentence  I’ll write “Rosalinda,” Teaching everyone who can read that the essence of every spirit Is contained in this one woman.

orig: translate old to modern: Hold, take my sword.
target: Stop, take my sword.

orig: translate old to modern: All?
target: All?

orig: translate old to modern: The heart is sorely charged.
target: The heart is sorely perplexed.

orig: translate old to modern: Who will go with me?
target: Who will go with me?

orig: translate old to modern: Why?
target: Why?

orig: translate old to modern: And what hope is that, I pray thee?
target: And what hope is that, please?

orig: translate old to modern: My hounds are bred out of the Spartan kind, So flew'd, so sanded; and their heads are hung With ears that sweep away the morning dew; Crook-knee'd and dew-lapp'd like Thessalian bulls; Slow in pursuit, but match'd in mouth like bells, Each under each.
target: My hounds are bred out of the Spartan kind, So jawed, so sandy-colored, and their heads are hung With ears that sweep along the ground; Crook-kneed and dew-covered like Thessaly bulls; Slow in pursuit, but matched in their barks like bells, Each one under the other.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, you deceive yourself.
target: Come on, you’re fooling yourself.

orig: translate old to modern: The Emperor calls Canidius.
target: The Emperor is calling for Canidius.

orig: translate old to modern: Hear'st thou of them?
target: Have you heard of them?

orig: translate old to modern: Rest, rest, perturbed spirit!
target: Rest, rest, irritated spirit!

orig: translate old to modern: Tis but an hour ago since it was nine, And after one hour more ’twill be eleven.
target: Only an hour ago it was nine, and in another hour it will be eleven.

orig: translate old to modern: A Cornish name.
target: That’s a Cornish name.

orig: translate old to modern: Sure, I shall never marry like my sisters, To love my father all.
target: I’m sure I’ll never get married in the way my sisters say they’re married, loving their father only.

orig: translate old to modern: Art thou his friend?
target: Are you his friend?

orig: translate old to modern: Who calls?
target: Who calls?

orig: translate old to modern: I had most need of blessing, and “Amen” Stuck in my throat.
target: I really needed blessing, and the "Amen" Stuck in my throat.

orig: translate old to modern: Small joy have I in being England’s queen.
target: I’ve had very little joy as England’s queen.

orig: translate old to modern: Where art thou, Pindarus?
target: Where are you, Pindarus?

orig: translate old to modern: What is the matter?
target: What is the matter?

orig: translate old to modern: In such a night To shut me out!
target: Imagine them locking me out on a night like this!

orig: translate old to modern: This villain of mine comes under the prediction—there’s son against father.
target: This wicked son of mine confirms the prediction —son against father.

orig: translate old to modern: The Mousetrap.
target: The Mousetrap.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor will you not tell me who you are?
target: And you won’t tell me who you are?

orig: translate old to modern: what news among the merchants?
target: What’s the news among the merchants?

orig: translate old to modern: Wilt thou set thy foot o' my neck?
target: May I kiss your feet?

orig: translate old to modern: Charmian, hark.
target: Do you hear that, Charmian?

orig: translate old to modern: O, where?
target: O, where?

orig: translate old to modern: Near Birnam Wood Shall we well meet them; that way are they coming.
target: We’ll meet them near Birnam wood They are coming that way.

orig: translate old to modern: I stay too long from her.
target: We’re wasting time here.

orig: translate old to modern: Or do you but counterfeit?
target: Or are you just pretending?

orig: translate old to modern: And therefore is he idle?
target: Does that mean he’s lazy?

orig: translate old to modern: I would I were at home.
target: I want to go home.

orig: translate old to modern: God bless your Grace with health and happy days.
target: God bless your Grace with health and happy days.

orig: translate old to modern: Away!
target: Go away!

orig: translate old to modern: How do you, women?
target: How are you, my ladies?

orig: translate old to modern: For if but once thou show me thy grey light, I'll find Demetrius, and revenge this spite.
target: Because, even if you only shine your grey light one time, I'll find Demetrius, and revenge this spite.

orig: translate old to modern: Why does he suffer this rude knave now to knock him about the sconce with a dirty shovel, and will not tell him of his action of battery?
target: Why does he allow this rude fellow to knock him about the head now, with a dirty shovel, and will not tell him why he’s being hit?

orig: translate old to modern: Sheathe your dagger.
target: Put your dagger away.

orig: translate old to modern: Normans, but bastard Normans, Norman bastards!
target: God alive!

orig: translate old to modern: The children live whose fathers thou hast slaughtered, Ungoverned youth, to wail it in their age; The parents live whose children thou hast butchered, Old barren plants, to wail it with their age.
target: There are parents living whose children you have butchered; they are now old withered plants who will moan over their losses as they grow old.

orig: translate old to modern: The town sounds a parley.
target: The town is asking for a pause in the fighting for negotiation.

orig: translate old to modern: I hate ingratitude more in a man Than lying, vainness, babbling, drunkenness, Or any taint of vice whose strong corruption Inhabits our frail blood—    O heavens themselves!
target: I hate an ungrateful man more than I hate lying, vanity, babbling, drunkenness, or any other vice that we feeble human beings are susceptible to.— Oh, my God!

orig: translate old to modern: Good night to everyone.
target: Good night to everyone.

orig: translate old to modern: Young gentleman, your spirits are too bold for your years.
target: Young gentleman, you are too bold for your age.

orig: translate old to modern: All for your delight We are not here.
target: All for your delight We are not here.

orig: translate old to modern: What's that, my lord?
target: What's that, my lord?

orig: translate old to modern: Brother of Gloucester, you mistake the matter.
target: Brother, you’ve made a mistake.

orig: translate old to modern: I would thou hadst been son to some man else.
target: I wish you were someone else’s son.

orig: translate old to modern: You cannot speak of reason to the Dane, And lose your voice.
target: You cannot start to ask the King of Denmark, And then stop.

orig: translate old to modern: Excellent, i' faith; of the chameleon's dish.
target: Excellent, really, of the chameleon's dish.

orig: translate old to modern: Is there any man has rebused your Worship?
target: Has anyone offended your Worship?

orig: translate old to modern: Lend me thy cloak, Sir Thomas.
target: Lend me your cloak, Sir Thomas.

orig: translate old to modern: Good sister, wrong me not nor wrong yourself, To make a bondmaid and a slave of me.
target: Dear sister, it’s unfair to me—and unfair to yourself—to turn me into a slave.

orig: translate old to modern: Thou flea, thou nit, thou winter cricket thou!
target: You flea, you louse, you winter cricket!

orig: translate old to modern: Tis but a peevish boy—yet he talks well— But what care I for words?
target: But what do I care about words?

orig: translate old to modern: To fly the boar before the boar pursues Were to incense the boar to follow us And make pursuit where he did mean no chase.
target: If we flee from the boar before the boar even pursues us, we’ll only make the boar angry and suspicious, causing him to chase us when he never intended to.

orig: translate old to modern: When did she send thee?
target: When did she send you?

orig: translate old to modern: It is.
target: It is.

orig: translate old to modern: Gone, sir.
target: Gone, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: God bless me from a challenge!
target: God forbid he wants to challenge me!

orig: translate old to modern: Come, go with me.
target: Come, go with me.

orig: translate old to modern: This shall end without the perdition of souls.
target: This may end without anyone getting killed.

orig: translate old to modern: He comes to kill my heart.
target: He has come to kill my heart.

orig: translate old to modern: How dost thou?
target: How are you doing?

orig: translate old to modern: It is indifferent cold, my lord, indeed.
target: It is unusually cold, my lord, indeed.

orig: translate old to modern: I know this, and thus I challenge it.
target: Well, I recognize this one  Good God!

orig: translate old to modern: Open ’t, and read it.
target: Open it and read it.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord?
target: My lord?

orig: translate old to modern: Who was't came by?
target: Who was it that came by?

orig: translate old to modern: I thank you.
target: Thanks for telling me.

orig: translate old to modern: How now?
target: So what’s going on?

orig: translate old to modern: Great tyranny, lay thou thy basis sure, For goodness dare not check thee.
target: Great tyranny, lay your foundation solid, Because goodness dare not challenge you!

orig: translate old to modern: With lawyers in the vacation, for they sleep between term and term, and then they perceive not how time moves.
target: For lawyers on vacation, because they sleep their holidays away, with no sense of how time moves.

orig: translate old to modern: As waggish boys in game themselves forswear, So the boy Love is perjured everywhere; For ere Demetrius look'd on Hermia's eyne, He hail'd down oaths that he was only mine; And when this hail some heat from Hermia felt, So he dissolv'd, and showers of oaths did melt.
target: Because, before Demetrius looked on Hermia's eyes, He swore many oaths that he was only mine; And, when this torrent of oaths was rejected by Hermia, Demetrius dissolved, and his oaths melted too.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, what should be the fear?
target: Why, what should I be afraid of?

orig: translate old to modern: But I’ll go in.
target: But I’ll go in.

orig: translate old to modern: There I deny my land service.
target: That’s the one part of my service on land I do deny.

orig: translate old to modern: Under Sir Thomas Erpingham.
target: Sir Thomas Erpingham.

orig: translate old to modern: How now, you dog?
target: What’s this, you dog?

orig: translate old to modern: Fare thee well.
target: Goodbye.

orig: translate old to modern: Name the day of marriage, and God give thee joy.
target: Tell us when you wish to get married, and may God give you joy.

orig: translate old to modern: We took him for a coward, but he’s the very devil incardinate.
target: We thought he was a coward, but he fights like a devil.

orig: translate old to modern: My friends told me as much, and I thought no less.
target: My friends told me as much, and I knew it, too.

orig: translate old to modern: Wouldst thou have that Which thou esteem'st the ornament of life And live a coward in thine own esteem, Letting “I dare not” wait upon “I would” Like the poor cat i’ the adage?
target: Would you have the crown Which you believe to be the ornament of life, And yet live like a coward in your own self-esteem, Letting "I shouldn’t" wait for "I would," Like the poor cat in the proverb?

orig: translate old to modern: Rude ragged nurse, old sullen playfellow For tender princes, use my babies well.
target: You are a rude, ragged nurse and an old, sullen playmate for such tender princes.

orig: translate old to modern: Shall we call in th' ambassador, my liege?
target: Shall we call in the ambassador, my liege?

orig: translate old to modern: Pardon me.
target: Forgive me.

orig: translate old to modern: I will go tell him of fair Hermia's flight; Then to the wood will he tomorrow night Pursue her; and for this intelligence If I have thanks, it is a dear expense.
target: I’ll tell him of fair Hermia's flight; Then tomorrow night, he will pursue her To the forest, and, even if he just thanks me For this knowledge, it is sweet payment.

orig: translate old to modern: This is the day which, in King Edward’s time, I wished might fall on me when I was found False to his children and his wife’s allies.
target: Today I’m going to get what I said I wished would happen to me if I was ever false to King Edward’s children or his wife’s allies.

orig: translate old to modern: Make peace with God, for you must die, my lord.
target: Make peace with God, for you must die, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: What is “t o”clock?
target: What time is it?

orig: translate old to modern: Come, how wouldst thou praise me?
target: Come, how would you praise me?

orig: translate old to modern: A surgeon!
target: a surgeon!

orig: translate old to modern: If she and I be pleased, what’s that to you?
target: If she and I are happy, what’s it to you?

orig: translate old to modern: Not Shafalus to Procrus was so true.
target: Not Shafalus to Procrus was so true.

orig: translate old to modern: I am called Dercetus.
target: My name is Decretus.

orig: translate old to modern: I will give thee mine.
target: I’ll give you mine.

orig: translate old to modern: I did very well note him.
target: I watched him very well.

orig: translate old to modern: Bite him to death, I [to Stephano] Lo, lo, again!
target: Look, look again!

orig: translate old to modern: Not so hot.
target: Not so fast.

orig: translate old to modern: O monstrous, monstrous!
target: Yes, monstrous, monstrous!

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, I did; But answer made it none.
target: My lord, I did, But it made me no answer.

orig: translate old to modern: The lunatic, the lover, and the poet, Are of imagination all compact.
target: The lunatic, the lover, and the poet Are all compact in their imagination.

orig: translate old to modern: It did come to his hands, and commands shall be executed.
target: It was addressed to him, and orders must be obeyed.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell her the king, that may command, entreats— That, at her hands, which the king’s King forbids.
target: Tell her that the king, who has the power to command people, asks her.

orig: translate old to modern: Dost thou hear?
target: Do you hear me?

orig: translate old to modern: That’s more than we know.
target: That’s more than we know.

orig: translate old to modern: What is the matter, masters?
target: What is the matter, gentlemen?

orig: translate old to modern: But as all is mortal in nature, so is all nature in love mortal in folly.
target: But everything that lives is mortal, including the foolishness of love.

orig: translate old to modern: Something we will determine.
target: Whatever we decide to do.

orig: translate old to modern: You may be pleased to catch at mine intent By what did here befall me.
target: You can judge for yourself what I mean.

orig: translate old to modern: He pulls Trinculo out from under Caliban's cloak by the legs] Thou art very Trinculo indeed!
target: You are very Trinculo indeed!

orig: translate old to modern: I have heard her swear ’t.
target: I’ve heard her say that.

orig: translate old to modern: So she may live unscarred of bleeding slaughter, I will confess she was not Edward’s daughter.
target: So that she may live, I’ll say I cheated on Edward and that she is not really his child.

orig: translate old to modern: No, truly.
target: No, really, I don’t.

orig: translate old to modern: Wilt thou make a trust a transgression?
target: What, is trusting a friend such a crime?

orig: translate old to modern: Therefore, out of my love to you, I came hither to acquaint you withal, that either you might stay him from his intendment or brook such disgrace well as he shall run into, in that it is a thing of his own search and altogether against my will.
target: I’m telling you all this out of affection for you, so you can either keep him from carrying out his plans or prepare to accept his disgrace, which will be his own fault, not mine.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, the enemy is past the marsh.
target: My lord, the enemy has already passed the marsh.

orig: translate old to modern: Hush!
target: Quiet!

orig: translate old to modern: This bodiless creation ecstasy Is very cunning in.
target: This bodiless creation Is very cunning In imagination.

orig: translate old to modern: Pleaseth your Grace To appoint some of your council presently To sit with us once more with better heed To resurvey them, we will suddenly Pass our accept and peremptory answer.
target: If your Grace would kindly appoint some members of your council to sit with me once more and go over them more carefully, I will give my answer and acceptance right away.

orig: translate old to modern: Edward’s unhappy sons do bid thee flourish.
target: Yes, I am.

orig: translate old to modern: Divinity of hell!
target: Divinity of hell!

orig: translate old to modern: No more dams I'll make for fish Nor fetch in firing At requiring, Nor scrape trenchering, nor wash dish ’Ban, ’Ban, Cacaliban Has a new master—get a new man!
target: I'll make no more mothers for fish; Or fetch in firing wood When asked to, Or scrape dishes, or wash dishes; 'Ban 'Ban, Ca—Caliban, Has a new master—Get a new man.

orig: translate old to modern: Off with his son George’s head!
target: Off with his son George’s head!

orig: translate old to modern: I’ the name of truth, Are ye fantastical or that indeed Which outwardly ye show?
target: In the name of truth, Are you fantastic beings or indeed what You look like?

orig: translate old to modern: If it be no more, Portia is Brutus' harlot, not his wife.
target: If it’s no more than this, Then Portia is Brutus' whore, not his wife.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, let them rest.—Come hither, Catesby.
target: Well, enough about them.—Come here, Catesby.

orig: translate old to modern: O, sir, I will not be so hard-hearted.
target: Oh, I’d never be that cruel.

orig: translate old to modern: No, faith, die by attorney.
target: No, you won’t die yourself, but only by proxy.

orig: translate old to modern: So I hope, I was not born to die on Brutus' sword.
target: I hope so; I was not born to die on Brutus' sword.

orig: translate old to modern: Farewell, kind Charmian.
target: Good-bye, kind Charmian.

orig: translate old to modern: Confess?—Handkerchief?—O devil!
target: O devil!

orig: translate old to modern: It is now two o'clock.
target: It’s two o'clock now.

orig: translate old to modern: I know him now.
target: Now I know him now.

orig: translate old to modern: He hates our sacred nation; and he rails, Even there where merchants most do congregate, On me, my bargains, and my well-won thrift, Which he calls interest.
target: He hates our sacred nation; and he abuses me, Even there where merchants congregate most of the time, Insulting me, my bargains, and my well-won success, Which he calls interest.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay me, what act, That roars so loud and thunders in the index?
target: Ah me, what act Roars so loudly and thunders in the wind?

orig: translate old to modern: Have with you.
target: I’m coming.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll go farther off.
target: I'll go farther away.

orig: translate old to modern: We did keep time, sir, in our catches.
target: We respected the beat of the song, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: He’ll say ’twas done cowardly, when he wakes.
target: When he wakes up!

orig: translate old to modern: Marry, and it shall be done tomorrow morning if I live.
target: Sure thing, we’ll do it tomorrow morning.

orig: translate old to modern: Lady!
target: Lady!

orig: translate old to modern: Hence, make your best of it.
target: Do whatever you want with it.

orig: translate old to modern: An evil soul producing holy witness Is like a villain with a smiling cheek; A goodly apple rotten at the heart; O, what a goodly outside falsehood hath!
target: An evil soul producing holy witness Is like a villain with a smiling cheek, A good apple rotten at the heart.

orig: translate old to modern: Beware the ides of March.
target: Beware the Ides of March.

orig: translate old to modern: I am very comptible, even to the least sinister usage.
target: I’m very sensitive, and even the smallest bit of rudeness hurts my feelings.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell me but this; Have you not sometimes seen a handkerchief Spotted with strawberries in your wife's hand?
target: Tell me but this, Haven’t you sometimes seen a handkerchief Spotted with strawberries in your wife's hand?

orig: translate old to modern: Let’s away And get our jewels and our wealth together, Devise the fittest time and safest way To hide us from pursuit that will be made After my flight.
target: We’ll figure out the best time and safest route to avoid being found out by my father’s guards, whom he’ll send out as soon as he discovers I’ve gone.

orig: translate old to modern: Never, till Caesar's three and thirty wounds Be well avenged, or till another Caesar Have added slaughter to the sword of traitors.
target: Never, until Caesar's thirty-three wounds Are well avenged, or until another Caesar Has added slaughter to the sword of traitors.

orig: translate old to modern: Oft have I heard of sanctuary men, But sanctuary children, ne'er till now.
target: Often I have heard of “sanctuary men,” but until now I’ve never heard of “sanctuary children.” My lord, you’ve won me over this time.

orig: translate old to modern: Let them be hunted soundly.
target: Let them be hunted soundly.

orig: translate old to modern: When I came back— For this was brief —I found them close together, At blow and thrust, even as again they were When you yourself did part them.
target: When I came back, For this was brief,--I found them close together, Everyone was fighting, even as again they were When you yourself parted them.

orig: translate old to modern: It is so.
target: It’s arranged.

orig: translate old to modern: Scant not my cups, and make as much of me As when mine empire was your fellow too, And suffered my command.
target: Keep my cups full and treat me as you did when my empire was one of your fellow servants, obeying my commands.

orig: translate old to modern: Signior Fabian, stay you by this gentleman till my return.
target: Mr. Fabian, stay with this gentleman until I come back.

orig: translate old to modern: O!
target: O!

orig: translate old to modern: For God's love let me hear!
target: For God's love, let me hear what you have to say.

orig: translate old to modern: And friends with Caesar.
target: And he’s friendly with Caesar.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll call upon you ere you go to bed And tell you what I know.
target: I’ll call on you before you go to bed, And tell you what I know.

orig: translate old to modern: Fear’st thou that, Antonio?
target: Do you have any doubts, Antonio?

orig: translate old to modern: O, then, what graces in my love do dwell, That he hath turn'd a heaven unto a hell!
target: Oh, so what graces, then, does he have, That he has turned a heaven into hell!

orig: translate old to modern: And did you leave him in this contemplation?
target: And did you leave him like this?

orig: translate old to modern: Adieu, good Queen.
target: Good-bye, good Queen.

orig: translate old to modern: breaks my pate across?
target: Breaks my head across?

orig: translate old to modern: And her sister By her is poisoned.
target: And her sister’s dead too, poisoned by your wife.

orig: translate old to modern: Let her be thine, for we Have no such daughter, nor shall ever see That face of hers again.
target: She’s no longer my daughter, and I’ll never see her face again.

orig: translate old to modern: I am sorry for thee, friend.
target: I’m sorry, my friend.

orig: translate old to modern: sits.—I did never think that lady would have loved any man.
target: I didn’t, either.

orig: translate old to modern: These gloves the Count sent me, they are an excellent perfume.
target: The Count sent me an excellent pair of perfumed gloves.

orig: translate old to modern: Will you hear me, Roderigo?
target: Will you listen to me, Roderigo?

orig: translate old to modern: First, Marcus Brutus, will I shake with you; Next, Caius Cassius, do I take your hand; Now, Decius Brutus, yours; now yours, Metellus; Yours, Cinna; and, my valiant Casca, yours; Though last, not least in love, yours, good Trebonius.
target: First, Marcus Brutus, I will shake with you;— Next, Caius Cassius, I take your hand;— Now, Decius Brutus, yours;—now yours, Metellus;— Yours, Cinna;—and, my valiant Casca, yours;— Though last, not least in love, yours, good Trebonius.

orig: translate old to modern: A blessèd labor, my most sovereign lord.
target: What blessed work, my king.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy luster thickens When he shines by.
target: Your light dulls when he is near.

orig: translate old to modern: A very gentle beast, and of a good conscience.
target: A very gentle beast, and of a good conscience.

orig: translate old to modern: O, here they come.
target: Here they come.

orig: translate old to modern: How fares my noble lord?
target: How is my noble lord?

orig: translate old to modern: We’ll so begin these rites As we do trust they’ll end, in true delights.
target: We’ll begin the ceremony the way we hope it will end—with delight.

orig: translate old to modern: O ye immortal gods!
target: O you immortal gods!

orig: translate old to modern: Take thou the bill, give me thy mete- yard, and spare not me.
target: You take the bill and I’ll take your yardstick.

orig: translate old to modern: Come on.
target: Let’s go.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me some light.
target: Give me some light.

orig: translate old to modern: I do not, sir.
target: I don’t, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Good gentlemen, give him a further edge And drive his purpose on to these delights.
target: Good gentlemen, cut him some slack, And keep his attentions on these delights.

orig: translate old to modern: Not black in my mind, though yellow in my legs.
target: My legs may be yellow, but I don’t feel blue.

orig: translate old to modern: We'll mutiny.
target: We'll rebel.

orig: translate old to modern: What prisoners of good sort are taken, uncle?
target: What prisoners of rank have been taken, uncle?

orig: translate old to modern: I forgive you the praise.
target: I’ll let you get away with skipping the praise.

orig: translate old to modern: Go with me, Silvius.
target: Come with me, Silvius.

orig: translate old to modern: You have done well, That men must lay their murders on your neck.
target: You have done well, That men must lay their murders on your neck.

orig: translate old to modern: Hark!
target: Listen!

orig: translate old to modern: Trouble us not.
target: Don’t bother us.

orig: translate old to modern: Good my liege— Peace, Kent.
target: But sir— Be quiet, Kent.

orig: translate old to modern: Tell him I’ll knock his leek about his pate Upon Saint Davy’s day.
target: Tell him I’ll take the leek out of his hat on Saint Davy’s Day and slap his head with it.

orig: translate old to modern: Mark him.
target: Watch him.

orig: translate old to modern: O upright, just, and true-disposing God, How do I thank thee that this carnal cur Preys on the issue of his mother’s body And makes her pew-fellow with others' moan!
target: Oh righteous God, how can I thank you enough that this meat-eating mutt preys on his mother’s children and forces her to join others in their grief!

orig: translate old to modern: Now, what my love is, proof hath made you know; And as my love is sized, my fear is so.
target: Now, you know how I love you has been proven to you, And as my love is cannot be measured, so is my fear.

orig: translate old to modern: This is a stem Of that victorious stock, and let us fear The native mightiness and fate of him.
target: This king is a branch of that same victorious stock.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis no matter how it be in tune, so it make noise enough.
target: It doesn’t matter if it’s in tune so long as it’s loud enough.

orig: translate old to modern: Why dost thou whet thy knife so earnestly?
target: Why do you sharpen your knife so earnestly?

orig: translate old to modern: Her name is Margery, indeed: I'll be sworn, if thou be Launcelot, thou art mine own flesh and blood.
target: Her name is Margery, indeed: I'll swear, if you are Launcelot, you are my own flesh and blood.

orig: translate old to modern: Your betters, sir.
target: Your superiors.

orig: translate old to modern: Let's take leave of him.
target: Let's tell him goodbye.

orig: translate old to modern: Yes, Cassius, and from henceforth, When you are overearnest with your Brutus, He'll think your mother chides, and leave you so.
target: Yes, Cassius, and, from here on in, When you’re over-aggressive with your Brutus, He'll think your mother scolds, and leave you alone.

orig: translate old to modern: Leave me alone to woo him.
target: Let’s go gather our jewels and money.

orig: translate old to modern: I do not like thy look, I promise thee.
target: I swear, I don’t like the look of you.

orig: translate old to modern: This is a man—old, wrinkled, faded, withered— And not a maiden, as thou say’st he is.
target: This is not a maiden, as you say, but an old man—wrinkled, faded, and withered.

orig: translate old to modern: Let him take thee And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians!
target: Let him hoist you up in front of the shouting crowds!

orig: translate old to modern: For, as I am a soldier, A name that in my thoughts becomes me best, If I begin the batt'ry once again, I will not leave the half-achieved Harfleur Till in her ashes she lie burièd.
target: For, as I am a soldier, the name I think suits me best, once I begin my attack on Harfleur again, I will not leave the half-conquered town until she lies buried in her own ashes.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, my good lord.
target: Yes, my good lord.

orig: translate old to modern: O, she was foul!
target: O, she was evil!

orig: translate old to modern: Of them I have much to tell thee.
target: I have much to tell you about them.

orig: translate old to modern: So I did, Fearing to strengthen that impatience Which seem'd too much enkindled, and withal Hoping it was but an effect of humor, Which sometime hath his hour with every man.
target: So I did, Fearing that I might make you more impatient When you seemed already fired up, and besides, I was hoping it was just a bad mood, Which sometimes hits every man.

orig: translate old to modern: Faith, here's an English tailor come hither, for stealing out of a French hose.
target: Truly, it must be an English tailor sent here for skimping on the fabric for a pair of a French hose.

orig: translate old to modern: But what talk I of this?
target: But why am I telling you this?

orig: translate old to modern: Good madam, hear me.
target: Good madam, let me speak.

orig: translate old to modern: So every bondman in his own hand bears The power to cancel his captivity.
target: And so every slave has in his own hand The power to cancel his captivity.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet I'll not shed her blood, Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow And smooth as monumental alabaster.
target: Still I won’t shed her blood; Or scar that skin of hers whiter than snow, And as smooth as the marble that makes monuments.

orig: translate old to modern: If Caesar please, our master Will leap to be his friend.
target: If Caesar chose, Antony would jump at the chance to be his friend.

orig: translate old to modern: How came we ashore?
target: How did we come ashore?

orig: translate old to modern: Give me mine angle.
target: Give me my fishing rod.

orig: translate old to modern: What is ’t thou say’st?
target: What are you saying?

orig: translate old to modern: Nor must not then be yielded to in this.
target: Then we won’t agree to his demands.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, stay and hear me speak.
target: Why, stay, And listen to me speak.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, I prithee stay a little.
target: Please, just wait a minute.

orig: translate old to modern: Do not yourself such wrong, who are in this Relieved but not betrayed.
target: We have not betrayed you.

orig: translate old to modern: What, a prisoner?
target: What, I’m a prisoner?

orig: translate old to modern: Well, Catesby, ere a fortnight make me older I’ll send some packing that yet think not on ’t.
target: But as for now—before two weeks have gone by, I’m going to send some people packing.

orig: translate old to modern: What kind of woman is’t?
target: What kind of woman is she?

orig: translate old to modern: And in this brainish apprehension kills The unseen good old man.
target: And in this headstrong state, kills The hidden good old man.

orig: translate old to modern: I thank your lordship, it is very hot.
target: I thank your lordship, it is very hot.

orig: translate old to modern: How shall I murder him, Iago?
target: How shall I murder him, Iago?

orig: translate old to modern: Two deep enemies, Foes to my rest, and my sweet sleep’s disturbers, Are they that I would have thee deal upon.
target: Two great enemies, in fact, enemies to my peace of mind.

orig: translate old to modern: Then learn this of me: to have is to have.
target: Then learn this from me: if you have something, you have it.

orig: translate old to modern: Art thou contented, Jew?
target: Are you content, Jew?

orig: translate old to modern: Orlando doth commend him to you both, And to that youth he calls his Rosalind He sends this bloody napkin.
target: Orlando sends his regards to you both, and he sends this bloody handkerchief to the boy he calls “his Rosalind.” Is that you?

orig: translate old to modern: Tis a good hand, A frank one.
target: It is a good hand, An open one.

orig: translate old to modern: Be assured We go to use our hands and not our tongues.
target: Rest assured that we’re going there to use our hands, not our tongues.

orig: translate old to modern: Was not that nobly done?
target: Wasn’t that nobly done?

orig: translate old to modern: Pray you, hasten Your generals after.
target: Go tell your generals to hurry their preparations.

orig: translate old to modern: Confess yourself to heaven; Repent what's past; avoid what is to come; And do not spread the compost on the weeds To make them ranker.
target: Confess yourself to heaven, Repent what's past, avoid what is to come, And don’t spread fertilizer on the weeds, To make them more rotten.

orig: translate old to modern: Farewell.
target: Farewell.

orig: translate old to modern: Who am I, sir?
target: Who am I, sir?

orig: translate old to modern: O mischief strangely thwarting!
target: Oh, mischief has ruined our plans!

orig: translate old to modern: Tis yours, and we, Your scutcheons and your signs of conquest, shall Hang in what place you please.
target: It’s yours, and you may hang us, your trophies of war, anywhere you like.

orig: translate old to modern: All that I will tell you is, that the Duke hath dined.
target: All that I will tell you is, that the duke has dined.

orig: translate old to modern: I take pleasure in singing, sir.
target: I like singing.

orig: translate old to modern: I know thy constellation is right apt For this affair.
target: I know you’re the right person for this job.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, Desdemona.
target: Yes, Desdemona.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, my good lord.
target: Yes, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: No more, cousin.
target: Enough, cousin.

orig: translate old to modern: Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire burn and cauldron bubble.
target: Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire, burn; and caldron, bubble.

orig: translate old to modern: Alas, she has no speech.
target: Alas, she has nothing to say.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, ’tis not so, my Lord High Constable.
target: You’ll discover that his youthful follies were like the persona that  Well, you’re wrong, my Lord High Constable.
